Left-click to paint the selected terrain type. Press ESC to cancel.
Right-click to sample terrain. Left-click to paint. Press ESC to cancel.
Left-click to paint forest. Press ESC to cancel.
Left-click to raise elevation, right-click to lower. Press ESC to cancel.
Left-click to paint sampled elevation, right-click to sample. Press ESC to cancel.
Left-click to roughen. Press ESC to cancel.
Left-click to place an object. Mouse wheel rotates. Press ESC to cancel.
Left-click and drag to delete objects. Press ESC to cancel.
Left-click to dig out water. Press ESC to cancel.
Left-click to select water. Press ESC to cancel.
Left-click a unit to see detailed help. Right-click to return to normal mode.
Left-click to create cliffs. Right-click to create canyons. Press ESC to cancel.
In modify terrain mode. Drag to select. Press the SPACEBAR to smooth. CTRL+SPACEBAR to flatten. [] to lower/raise.
Left-click to smooth area. Press ESC to cancel.
Left-click and drag to move a unit. Mouse wheel rotates. Or use arrows to move selected unit around, CTRL+LEFT ARROW (or RIGHT ARROW) to rotate.
Left-click to place first wall endpoint.
Left or Right-click to set gather point.
Left-click in the world or Mini Map to send flare.
Left-click and drag to select an area to copy. CTRL+C to perform the copy. Press ESC to cancel.
Left-click to paste units from clipboard. Mouse wheel rotates units. Press ESC to cancel.
Left-click to paste the contents of the terrain clipboard. Select paste options on dialog. Press ESC to cancel.
Left-click on the terrain to set the location. Right-click or press ESC to cancel.
Left-click to choose where to unload.
Left-click to choose where to patrol.
Paint Terrain Overlay mode. Left-click to paint terrain overlay. Right-click to remove terrain overlay.

The game will proceed with sound disabled.
If you think you have received this message in error, try rebooting your computer and running the game again.

If you know there are problems with your sound hardware, or you do not have sound hardware installed, you can avoid seeing this message by running the Age of Empires III No Sound shortcut from your Start menu.

Choose the size for your game's map, relative to number of players. Maps with more players will automatically be larger.
Choose the size for your game's map.

Select the visibility on the map. Default is Normal which means areas of the map are not visible until you or an ally explores that area. Revealed Map means that areas are visible, but can be hidden by Fog of War.
Select the level of resources in the game world. If you choose Scarce, resources will be harder to find. A Flush resource level means that there are many resources.
Check this box if you want resources to be shared among your team.
Check this box if you want population to be shared among your team.
Check this box if you want teams to be locked for the entire game.
Allowing Cheats will severely unbalance the game, but might be a fun diversion.
Recording a game allows you to watch a movie of the game at a later time. You can access Record Games from the Main menu.
Check this box if you want a co-op game. In a co-op game, players on the same team can control one another's units.
Check this box if you want to restrict the number of times a player can pause the game.

Slow, infinite source of Food. Limited to 10 gatherers.
Heavy ranged infantry. Armed with a bayonet to beat cavalry.
Archaic heavy infantry. Good against cavalry and buildings.
Villager that constructs buildings and gathers resources.
The leader of your New World colony. Explores, fights, builds Town Centers and Trading Posts. Cannot die. If he falls unconscious, he can be rescued.
Herd animal. Fattens over time. Fattens faster if tasked on a Livestock Pen.
Caravel. Good at exploring, fishing or transport.
Build near Native American settlements or Trade Routes. Provides Experience Points and other benefits.
Most important building in a colony. Home City arrival point. Supports 10 population. Can only be built by Explorers or sent from the Home City.
Harvest for Food with Fishing Boats.
Trains and upgrades hand and ranged infantry.
Word of your discovery has spread. Villagers from your home city arrive to usher in the Colonial Age.
Trains and upgrades hand and ranged cavalry.
Trains healers and provides colony improvements and unique improvements.
Light cavalry that sacrifices hitpoints for attack.
Slow, heavy infantry with a large attack.
Light cavalry armed with cold steel.
Light artillery. Good against other artillery.
Light artillery. Better against infantry than buildings.
Light infantry with low hitpoints, but a long-ranged attack. Good against infantry.
Light artillery that throws grenades to defeat infantry or buildings.
Gathers Food from Fish or Coin from Whales.
Heavy artillery. Good against infantry or buildings.
Dutch reconnaissance unit with a good line of sight but weak attack.
Artillery that fires an exploding shell at buildings or ships.
Archaic long-ranged archer. Good against infantry.
Heavy cavalry with a trample attack.

War Wagon attack and hitpoints increased.

INDUSTRIAL AGE! Railroads and Factories can empower your economy.
Archer and hand infantry hitpoints increased.
Infantry armed with firearms have their attack increased.
Trunion invention makes artillery more mobile.
Infantry armed with muskets or rifles hitpoints increased.
Musketeer, Janissary, Highlander and Grenadier hand attack increased.
Skirmishers armed with rifles (Skirmishers, Abus Guns, Cassadores, Jaegers, Strelets, Cherokee, Cree) do more damage to heavy infantry (Musketeers, Halberdiers, etc.)
Artillery and combat buildings do more damage to war ships.
Villagers gather Food from hunted animals faster.
Livestock fatten faster when tasked on Livestock Pens.

Cuirassier attack and hitpoints greatly increased.
Ships 4 Young Guard Grenadiers from the motherland.
Progressive law causes your villagers to gather all resources more quickly. However, the additional bureaucracy increases building cost.
Aztec warrior armed with an obsidian sword.
Aztec infantry that flings javelins from an atlatl. Good against infantry.
Comanche ranged cavalry. Good against cavalry.
Selective breeding of horses increases cavalry hitpoints.
Using Aztec floating garden methods, your villagers gather Food from Mills faster, and Boats gather from Fish and Whales faster.
Aztec warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
Comanche warrior attack and hitpoints increased.

Iroquois warrior that hurls tomahawks into battle.
Cree woven cloth can be used to lessen the cost of your buildings. All buildings cost less Wood.
Special Seminole tactics for destroying enemy infrastructure mean that your Sharktooth Bowmen do more damage to buildings.
Practice the Iroquois sport of Lacrosse. Ranged infantry attack increased.
The Iroquois allow you to train Tomahawks and Mantlets out of your Barracks like regular units.
Iroquois warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
Seminole warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
Russian combination of Barracks and Outpost. Can defend the frontier or train infantry in groups. It also supports 5 population.

Weak but cheap light infantry. Good against infantry.

Native boat that can attack or transport units.

Powerful cavalry available only from the Home City.

A southern conifer such as longleaf pine. Harvest for Wood.

Fast Incan communications lets you train soldiers faster.
Villagers gather Coin from Mines faster.
Ships a Factory Wagon to the New World, allowing you to construct a powerful Factory to produce resources or heavy artillery.

Explorer's Camps must be built near Secret Ruins.

Texas: an open plain with some cliffs and two Trade Routes.
Home City colonists arrive here. You can move this flag anywhere around the edge of a map or set a waypoint from it.
Back up to previous selection state.
Conquistador - most Victory Point buildings destroyed
Place your building in this colony.
The crusades are dead! Your knighthood is all that remains - a relic!
I'm not ready to die just yet, Falcon! And I don't intend to see our knighthood broken!
Slow, infinite source of Coin. Limited to 10 gatherers.
Plantations must be built near native resources, such as Tobacco.
Only one Plantation can be built near a native resource.
Build your Plantation near this native resource.
A big rodent. Harvest for Food.
Villagers are Coureurs - expensive, but gather and fight better than Settlers. Best units: Skirmisher, Cuirassier.
Manor Houses spawn Settlers when built. Best units: Musketeer, Hussar.
Earns Home City Shipments faster. Best units: Pikeman, Rodelero, Lancer.
Gets a free Covered Wagon with every Age. Best units: Musketeer, Dragoon.
Small Settler population, but can build Banks to produce Coin. Settlers cost Coin. Best units: Skirmisher, Ruyter.
Free Uhlans with every Shipment. Two kinds of villagers. Best units: Skirmisher, Uhlan.
Trains Settlers and infantry in batches. Blockhouse combines an Outpost and Barracks. Best units: Grenadier, Cavalry Archer.
Town Centers produce Settlers for free. Mosques improve Settler production. Best units: Grenadier, Hussar.
Your Settlers gather much more quickly from Mills, but somewhat more slowly from everything else. (Does not affect Fishing Boats.)
Well done, Morgan. The Turks are holed up in the caves to the east. If we attack now, we can drive them from Malta.
Nothing would please me more, my lord.
You men, with me! Bring that bombard.
We do not have to fight, Frenk. Do you never question foolish orders?
Why do you call me that? I'm Scottish.
All you Europeans are Frenk to me. Continue to act blindly, Morgan, and you and your pathetic knighthood will be irrelevant in the modern world.
Emphasis on commercial pursuits gives you 2000 Experience Points towards your next Shipment.
Spanish Pikeman attack and hitpoints greatly increased.
Increases the speed of allied soldiers in the area for 60 seconds.
A tame jaguar who is good against guardians.
Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
Lights a fire that burns across the prairie, damaging units and soldiers.

Type a name for your explorer.
Snowy forests, plenty of silver, and sometimes a river.
Build a Trading Post at this site for Victory Points.

Heals injured units. Can build Field Hospitals.

"These are our lands, but we will permit you to build a Trading Post here to forge an alliance between our people."
A herd of 12 Bison appear at your Town Center.
Native American building. Build a Trading Post to forge an alliance.
"These are our lands, but we will permit you to build a Trading Post here to forge an alliance between our people."
Inspired by your generosity, the Nootka rally to your flag. Nootka train faster and are cheaper.
You have chosen Genoa as your patron city. In return, you have access to all Ranged Infantry and their techs.
Tower that can be used to defend the frontier.
Forts cannot be placed near other Forts or enemy defenses.
"These are our lands, but we will permit you to build a Trading Post here to forge an alliance between our people."
"We are allied with another European ... for now."
"My ally, do you request warriors or knowledge this year?"
Surgeons are now available at the Cathedral.
Priests are now available at the Cathedral.
A small, shaggy cow. Harvest for Food.
Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
Slow, infinite source of Coin. Limited to 4 gatherers.
Place Home City Gather Point for current player. Press ESC to cancel.
Explorer Camps, Native Outpost, Trading Posts
Left-click to place Trade Route waypoint. Right-click to remove last waypoint placed. ESC to cancel.
Provides early economic improvements and exchanges one resource for another.
The Iroquois prepare for war! You get a Shipment of Mantlets. You get 1 Mantlet for every 2 minutes the game has lasted.
Normal Mode. Weakest attack, but you can sail at full speed.
Broadside Mode. Cannon barrage only good against ships. Movement is slow.
A servant of the Circle of Ossus.
So this is what the Ottomans really wanted on Malta.
A library carved in stone ... very old. This writing was left by the Circle of Ossus.
They are a secret society. Some say they are the most powerful men in Europe; others say they are nothing more than scientists and alchemists. They seek a means for eternal life.
The writing refers to the Lake of the Moon, a place known only to the Aztecs. America sive nobi orbis.
Sahin and the Ottomans are on their way there now. Defeat them and find this lake. The future of the knighthood depends on your success.
Land! I saw it first! The reward is mine!
You'll get your gold, but be cautious. These are unfamiliar waters.
A ship! Filled to the gunwales with explosives. It came out of nowhere.
And there's more where that came from.
We are Knights of St. John. We do not surrender!
Make land. We need to hold them off until the other ships arrive and we can force our way through.
Never thought I'd be setting my heels in the sands of the bleeding Americas.
Keep the men together. We don't know what predators lurk in that jungle -- animal or human.
Be alert -- the Turks may have beaten us here.
The Aztec city is north of here. The Spanish are laying siege.
If we help the Aztecs, perhaps they will tell us the location of the Lake of the Moon. What of the Turks?
They're beaten. We killed most of the survivors in the jungle, and the Spanish captured the rest.
Pure white -- I've never seen such a thing.
I have -- on the walls of the caves in Malta. I do not like this. This New World holds many dangers.
Does this animal mean the Circle of Ossus is in the New World?
I fear so, and if the Circle seeks the Lake of the Moon, we must beat them to it. Prepare the men. The Aztec city is deep in the jungle, and we will have to cut our way through.
I don't understand. There's no gold here. What were the Spanish after?
The Lake of the Moon is in Florida. Send word to Alain.
So ... we have captured not only Aztecs, but a Turk as well. What is an Ottoman doing in the New World?
I have no quarrel with you, conquistador. All I wanted was a look at an old map.
Si, si ... the Lago del Luna. I saw the map too.
My treasure fleet will be stopping in la Florida. Water from this lake of yours will make me a rich man when I return to Spain.
So, you would take the water for yourself. You conquistadors are no better than the Circle.
The Circle has enclaves in Prague and Alexandria -- even your precious Spain. Have you not seen the white animals?
Bah! The Circle of Ossus is nothing more than a legend -- no match for powder and steel!
Put the Turk in the hold with the other prisoners. He will face the fire when we return to Spain.
It'll have to be in dry-dock for quite a while before it's seaworthy again.
Not good enough. We need to sail right away.
If you try to get to Florida in that, you'll be swimming the last hundred miles. Consider yourself lucky you made it to port at all in a hurricane.
Well, well -- Morgan Black. So the New World hasn't killed you off yet. What's this I hear about Florida?
Oh, come now. You sent my best ships to the bottom; the least you owe me is a little civility. Are you going after the treasure fleet?
Aye. We're going after the Spanish, but we don't want their gold. If you take us to Florida, it's yours.
Hah! I like the idea of your knights keeping the Spaniards busy while I make off with the plunder, I really do. But I'm not sure you're up to the task.
And you are? Those pirates of yours are too scruffy and underfed to stand toe-to-toe with an army of conquistadors.
Point taken. But still, I don't make a habit of sailing with knights. Perhaps I'll let you and your men come along with me, but you'll have to prove yourself first.
Look there -- the Spanish. The treasure fleet will be somewhere nearby.
It is my commander, Alain! He must have received my message!
Excellent work, Morgan. You have accomplished everything I asked you to do. I will ride inland and prevent the Spanish from reaching the lake.
What would you have me do?
Take their treasure fleet. We will use their ill-gotten gains to rebuild our knighthood.
Wait just a minute, old man!
Elisabet, please -- let me handle this!
Morgan, when this business with the Spaniards is over, we must discuss your choice of friends.
So, Sahin -- it seems your Spanish friends have left you here to die.
If you kill me, there will be no one to stop the Circle of Ossus.
Well done, Morgan. The treasure fleet is ours, and my men control the lake.
I will warn you as I warned the conquistador. The Lago Del Luna is an elder power. Do not trifle with it.
Morgan, why is that savage still alive?
The Inca prisoners helped us against the Spanish. It makes no sense to kill them.
I am Knight Commander, and you will follow my orders. Execute the Turk and the others, then rendezvous with me at the Lake.
Do you see it now, Frenk? You have been tricked.
Open your eyes! The Circle of Ossus wants the lake because they think it is the Fountain of Youth! All I have been doing is trying to keep it out of the hands of the Circle -- and Alain Magnan!
What are you saying? Alain has given his whole life to this knighthood. He's no member of this Circle.
Morgan, he makes sense. Alain left you to fight the Spanish while he raced ahead to the lake.
I don't trust either of you, but I do not know what to make of Alain's actions. I'll see this Fountain of Youth and make my decision then.
Look -- there are knights all around the lake.
See the men with Alain? They are Boneguard -- the Circle's elite soldiers.
This is knight's business now. Alain made me a pawn in the Circle's game. He has betrayed the Knights of St. John, and he'll answer for it.
If you want revenge, keep him from getting his prize -- the Fountain's water.
Destroy it. It is the only way. You cannot leave the Fountain of Youth in the hands of such men.
We can make a few fire ships, but I am low on black powder.
I am Ottoman. I have more than you could possibly ever use.
Fetch that powder, Sahin. We're going to need all of it.
Native American building. Build a Trading Post to forge an alliance.
"These are our lands, but we will permit you to build a Trading Post here to forge an alliance between our people."
Too slow, John Black. You were faster once.
And your eyes were better once. Your arrow missed the mark. My shot was the one that took him down.
Only a few more miles to Brunswick, boys. We've marched long and hard, and you all deserve a hot meal.
This is a waste of time. Your uncle sees a shadow in the forest and cries for help.
Stuart is not the commander my grandfather Morgan was, but if he says the colony is threatened, I believe him.
Why would the Cherokee attack? Brunswick is far from their lands.
Who knows? The colonists can't afford to take chances, and as long as they line our pockets, their interests are mine.
Uncle, what happened here? Where's the garrison?
These few men are all that's left. The others died in the last raid, and the Cherokee carried off most of the survivors.
Another war party is on the way.
Shore up the defenses and open the arsenal! I want every colonist that can hold a musket on the walls!
Yucatan: dense jungles and nearby natives.
Get the men together. We're going after the Cherokee.
Nephew, you are paid to protect the colony.
If the Cherokee make it back to their villages, they'll return in force. We have to take the fight to them.
Six of you stay here to protect the wounded. The rest with us.
Why would British soldiers attack their own colony?
The raids were just a distraction. The soldiers meant to draw the garrison away from the colony and then attack.
I know why -- the Circle. My family has powerful enemies.
Then my tribe and my sister may also be in danger. We must get back to New England.
Brother. What took you so long?
We'll have our revenge on the British.
The new British governor, Warwick -- he knows you, John.
Warwick doesn't need to look for me. I'll go to him.
There were too many, General ... we couldn't stop them.
Native rabble sending British regulars scrambling for the hills? I'm disappointed, Captain.
There were mercenaries with the Iroquois ... John Black's men.
So ... the fox has finally been flushed from his den.
Clean yourself up, Captain. You have work to do.
Amazonia: fight along the mighty Amazon River.
Carolina: start with extra resource crates on this coastal map.
Have you told your brother about us yet?
No. Later, when it is a quieter time, he will accept it. But not now.
The French are moving against the British. Your people will be caught in the middle.
What would you have us do? Better to ally with the French than this Warwick.
Dawn's coming. Let's go meet these French.
No sign of Warwick or my uncle.
Look there -- a flag of truce.
I'm Colonel Washington. Why are your mercenaries fighting for the French?
We'll stand down. Just give us Warwick.
Warwick is a renegade. He ordered the attack on the natives without the authorization of the crown, and he'll answer for it.
Then I'm afraid your uncle is dead. But if you want to pursue Warwick, you'll have British support.
Do you believe Warwick is part of this Circle you told me of?
Yes, and going after him will be dangerous. Nonahkee should stay here.
You will find my sister makes her own choices.
We'll track your traitor for you, Colonel Washington.
What does this Circle want from your family?
They're just madmen chasing after an old legend. They believe my grandfather Morgan knew the location of the Fountain of Youth.
It's just a legend. Come on. My uncle's down there somewhere.
It is your uncle. I will put him to rest where the others fell.
Warwick's trail is still warm. He heads west across the plains. We will catch him if we move quickly.
Nonahkee goes home. This will end badly, and I don't want her to see it.
You already know about us, don't you?
John Black, I would not have chosen you as a husband for my sister. She should have someone more ... settled.
These plains -- I have never seen land such as this.
Be careful. I know nothing of the people of this land.
They may know where Warwick is. Come on.
Should we wait for more reinforcements? Washington has promised more men and supplies.
We can't wait. We'll just have to steal our supplies from Warwick.
Another tribe from across the water?
Yes ... but a different water. The Pacific Ocean.
The pass is clear. There is nothing to stop them.
Not for long. What are you going to do?
I'm going to bring the mountain down.
The New World belongs to the Circle of Ossus now, Black.
You're right. It seems you're the keeper of the family secret.
Perhaps. Are you made of sterner stuff than your uncle? I so love a challenge.
Broadside Attack Mode is currently unavailable.
This unit is currently in Broadside Attack Mode.
Normal Attack Mode is currently unavailable.
This unit is currently in Normal Attack Mode.
Medium ground bird. Harvest for Food.
Amelia Black. The girl that owns Falcon Company. Is it true your grandmother was a Mohawk?
Sorry, old man, but I don't have time to chat.
They say that Falcon's laying tracks all the way to the West Coast.
That's the plan, unless we get beat by our competitors. I've got to go, old timer.
Is it true what they say? That Falcon Company's bankrupt?
The government's not convinced you can get this job done, Black. You're going to have to prove to us you can beat the other companies before you'll get the contract.
The government will get its railroad, Major Cooper. Just keep my men alive. Then you can go back to fighting Mexicans or Seminoles or whatever it is you do.
You'll get paid soon enough. You did good work here, Black. Getting supplies down to the border forts was crucial. The Mexican army is on the move again.
Keep your workers out of our way.
Fine. But I'm staying at the wall.
She can fight, this pretty one.
Pierre Beaumont is what I'm called. The Mexican army chased me all the way up here, and now we are trapped together, non? I will show you the way I like to kill.
The Mexicans will try to cut off our supplies. Conserve as many resources as you can.
I've got to go finish the railroad if I'm going to get paid.
These days, you have not enough money, yes? So now I help you. With gold from my claim, up in the mountains.
You have men. I am alone. Your men mine the claim. You take half of what they dig up.
Seventy percent, and I want to see the mine first.
Done. I go with you to Colorado. We stop on the way, see the mine, then you go home to play with your little trains. We'll go now, yes?
Not far, see? In the cave, there.
You have followed me for too many years, old one. We settle this here, you and I, like men.
Not today, Beaumont. I brought the cavalry.
Thank the Indian. He tracked you for many miles across rough ground.
How did you know about Beaumont?
We will talk later, when there is time. Drive Beaumont from the mines. I will go get help from the local native villages.
Grandniece. It has been a long time.
Yes -- five years since my father's funeral. Why are you here?
I have been on Beaumont's trail for months. He and the Circle of Ossus believe you know where to find the Lake of the Moon.
That old story again? Did you forget what year this is?
The Circle is all too real -- your grandfather John learned that before he died. Beaumont is their leader now.
The Circle won't find anything at the lake. The Fountain of Youth is just a myth.
Escaped, and killed my best men in the process.
You see? Beaumont will go to Florida, and extract from the Seminoles what he could not learn from you. And even if the lake is a myth, there is lost Spanish gold in the swamps.
Grand Inquisitor, the Seminole says the Inca took the water, but he does not know where they went.
Be sure he knows nothing. Take his toes first, then his fingers, one at a time.
We have found several doubloons, but most of the Spanish fleet is still buried.
Get the gold, then we search for the water. Dig faster. The pretty one and her friends will be here soon.
They are no match for the Circle of Ossus.
Perhaps so, perhaps not. Find the Spanish gold quickly, or I will take more than fingers from you.
Your ancestors first fought the Circle here. They destroyed the Fountain and sank the Spanish treasure fleet. The gold may still be buried nearby.
Don't worry. Beaumont won't get that gold.
Surrender, or you'll face justice right here!
The Circle's stronghold is in Havana, but I am not so sure that is where Beaumont went. The local Seminoles have a legend ... but their chief can explain better than I can.
In the time of the knight Morgan, the Inca took many barrels of the water to Pacamayo Valley.
Inca? The Inca are all dead.
My father told me that many captives returned to their homeland when the Spanish fleet was sunk.
Then we must find their homeland before Beaumont does.
You have helped bring freedom to my people. How can we repay you?
Can you spare a guide? We need to travel east to Pacamayo Valley.
I will send men with you, but be careful. The mountains are treacherous this time of year.
We'll take our chances. Good luck, General.
I know who you are. You are the descendent of the knight who saved my people long ago. This battle was years in the making.
The water is not important. My people must come first. Help us defend the last city of the Inca, Amelia Black.
This is not over yet. Beaumont escaped with several barrels of the water.
The Circle has blocked the eastern pass. You cannot follow.
Now that they have the water, they will assemble in the Ossuary. It is their stronghold near Havana.
So you believe in the legend of the Fountain's water?
I don't know what to believe ... but what will the world be like if Beaumont lives forever?
The navy said they'd send warships to fight the Circle. Where are they?
In my experience, the American government's promises are ... less than reliable.
They're just late. Get to shore and set up camp.
Yep. Falcon Company wasn't the first, but we'll still get a piece of the pie.
The papers are saying your money troubles are over.
We managed to find some new ... investors. In Florida and Cuba.
Good, glad to hear it. Your family must be so proud.
This land belongs to you now. You and folks like you -- folks with steel in their backbone.
I'd stay and chat, old timer, but the train's coming.
You broke the Circle -- and in just one lifetime, too.
This unit is currently limbered and cannot attack.
My lord, the Turks are moving in the great bombards. How can we defeat them with pike and shot?
We can't. We need cavalry. We need to signal Commander Alain and the rest of the knights.
Morgan the Ottomans are flanking to try and attack the settlers on the hill.
Move the crossbow to the forward walls to attack the janissaries! Defend the fort at all costs!
Why is the signal fire lit and why am I here, Morgan? I ordered you to defend the fort.
Use the pikemen to attack the Ottoman cavalry.
Well, the Falcon can't stand up to my heavy cavalry. Lead on, Morgan and destroy those cannon.
It appears the Falcon is gone.
Get some settlers to the top of the hill to the west and light the signal fire.
Good job. Let's get that last one.
The Frenks are on the hill trying to send a signal.
We'll have to hurry then. Get some men up the hill and defend those settlers. If they die we die.
Send a ship around their flank and attack those settlers.
My lord, Sahin the Falcon is advancing with great bombards.
We've done it, the signal fire is burning!
More bombards! I hope Alain is on his way.
The Ottomans are protecting weapons and supplies in the caves to the east. We must push them out of there.
We need to build an artillery foundry and train hoop throwers. They know how to deal with janissaries.
We have to destroy all these weapon caches!
The Ottomans are using the caves to stage their attacks on Malta. We must stop them.
There's the entrance to the caves! The weapons caches must be inside.
Attack the weapon caches with anything to blow them up.
The Ottomans built those buildings too close to the shore. Our ships can get within range to bombard them!
Continue expanding the colony, we will need military buildings and a dock before we can fight our way past this pirate.
The pirate Elisabet has a small base on this island.
Our ship is badly damaged. Start a colony on this island and wait for more ships to arrive from Malta.
This ship is too damaged to fight through those fireships. We risk losing our covered wagon!
Destroy the pirate's fireships before they can ram us!
Thanks to that pirate, we'll need some new ships.
Royal Decree to Claim the New World
Provides your Church with unique Spanish improvements.
And now this knight chases me all the way to the New World?
He does not understand. We are not after the Lake of the Moon. We just want to keep it away from the Circle.
Now we can hunt for Sahin and the Turks.
The Aztec city is under attack by the Spanish! We must help defend it!
Prove yourself worthy to sail with me before I leave, and I'll take you to Florida.
Making a name for myself in these islands should impress Lizzie. I'll have to find ways to improve my reputation.
Ahh ... Morgan Black, you've made quite a name for yourself around here.
I've had men more famous than you aboard my ship, Morgan. Come back when people around here know who you are.
We've got to find a way to destroy them.
We'll have to siege the forts from land.
We need to capture just one more treasure ship.
We can't sail past those forts - they have the bay entrance covered with cannon. They'll tear us to shreds.
Morgan Black has come to my rescue? Unbelievable.
Not to worry, Falcon. I just want the honor of gutting you myself.
The Boneguard are attempting to re-capture the fixed gun -- stop them!
We've got to keep up our attacks on the Fountain of Youth.
Our base has been overrun. All is lost.
If we target the fixed gun on the Fountain it will help us destroy it.
We have captured the great cannon!
The Circle has re-captured the fixed gun! We must kill all their soldiers near it to take it back!
The Circle's fort is too well defended. We need to destroy the Fountain to prevent Alain from getting what he wants!
The Circle has landed troops on our shore - they may try to re-capture the fixed gun.
Perhaps we can lure a few enemy ships into range of the fixed gun.
There is a Seminole tribe nearby. You may be able to gain their help, if the Circle have not imprisoned them.
I don't understand. The Cherokee have always been peaceful neighbors. Why are they attacking?
The Cherokee are right behind us!
Get them into the colony! Hurry!
Cherokee warriors! Attacking from the south!
Cherokee warriors! Attacking from the north!
Cherokee warriors! Attacking from the west!
Cherokee warriors! Attacking from the east!
More colonists ... get them into the colony!
Cannon? How did the Cherokee get cannon!?
Cannon at the walls! We've got to destroy them!
Push them back and repair that wall!
You colonists will have to fight alongside us. Give them weapons -- they're militia now!
Those are British riflemen. What are they doing here?
That explains the Cherokee cannon ... they have allied with the British!
Pull back! We don't have enough men to fight the British! We'll have to establish a base!
Sir, British frigates are shelling the colony! Stuart needs your help!
Ride back and tell Stuart that we'll do what we can. We've got our own problems here.
We've driven off the British warships!
I do not like this. They are leading us further and further into the woods.
Pirate mercenary from the Barbary coast.
My people cannot hold off the British for long.
We must keep up our attacks, regardless of the losses!
If the British are fighting us, the Iroquois can mount an attack from the other side.
See if we can't get some cannon up on high ground, on the sides of the British camp.
We are losing much of our village, brother. We cannot hold out for long.
The tribe is preparing to attack the British on our side.
If we take out the British mortars on the other side they can no longer attack the buildings in the Iroquois village.
The warriors of my sister's village have broken through the British walls.
The British white men will pay at the hands of those Iroquois warriors.
Captain, once we are through the walls, help the Iroquois destroy the entire British camp.
Starts a new colony by transforming into a Town Center. Most civilizations can only have 1 Town Center until the Fortress Age.
For what the British have done to my sister's village, every building must be destroyed.
It looks like the French could use our help.
Take the men and help push the British back across the river.
We must make sure there are no British soldiers on our side of the river.
Thank you for lending support. Join us in this border war and help us defeat the British.
In order to defeat the British we will need to destroy all the forts on their side of the river.
The wood from the trees in this area is too poor to build ships with -- we'll have to rely on your navy, Colonel Washington.
My warships will sail into these great lakes soon. In the meantime we should establish a base here, and construct some cannon!
My warships will be arriving one at a time.
We won't be able to challenge Warwick in the next lake until all of my warships are here.
Anchor Washington's warship near this Secret -- we'll need it for defense while we wait for the third ship to arrive!
Anchor Washington's ship at the mouth of the bay and prepare to weather an attack from the water!
It's time! Gather all of my warships together -- we'll strike Warwick with my navy's full strength.
We must take out the outposts of these Boneguard before my warships arrive.
Anchor Washington's ship at the mouth of the bay for maximum defense against possible naval assault.
We'll use land units to siege the Boneguard outposts around this great lake -- don't forget the cannon!
If our coffers run low we may need to establish a trade route for funds.
This Warwick and his Boneguard seek to kill all the chiefs on the plains. Earn the respect of the tribes before the last chief is killed, and Warwick will be driven from our lands.
The Boneguard are attacking a tribe. Stop them!
We should build a trading post at the Lakota village near where we first arrived.
The sacred hilltop has been cleansed.
We are going to need resources to build up and defend ourselves, but we have little food, wood, or coin.
Warwick is getting wagonloads of resources. Let's relieve him of some of them.
Warwick's base is much too well defended for us to assault now, but we can steal some of the supply wagons being escorted into his fort.
Bring the stolen supply wagon to our town center so we can use the resources ourselves.
The supply wagons appear to carry food, wood, coin or are loaded with a combination of all three resources.
We only have a short amount of time before Warwick's fort will be too well-defended to destroy.
Another attack on our town -- we've got to hold out until we can launch a counter-attack!
We cannot siege Warwick's fort yet -- it is too strong.
We have captured another supply wagon.
We only have five minutes left to destroy Warwick's fort.
That's one less supply wagon for Warwick, and one more for us.
Another platoon of Russians is approaching!
The Russians are bringing cannon into the pass. They'll be able to reach us on the cliffs!
The Russians have got a cannon through!
Another cannon has made it past us!
Allying with the Indians in this region will greatly help us get this railroad through.
Only our trading posts can be built along the trade route to complete this railroad.
Indians are attacking the trading post.
The Falcon Company will never own the railroad in this region.
Build defenses around our trading post.
We should get some men out to all of the trading posts to help defend them..
A train is on the way. We must defend it!
If we upgrade our trade route to locomotives we will get the resources much faster.
The trains are bringing resources into the fort! The trading posts must not fall!
Ha ha! That's ten Mexicans for me, cheri!
We must find a way into the mines to help our friends.
Thank you for freeing me ... but there are more prisoners in these mines.
They are trapped -- we must find another way in. They will not last long without our warriors.
We'll have to make do without Kanyenke and his men ... let's go.
We've flattened one of the outposts. Two more to go.
Two outposts down, one to go.
We've got to destroy the outposts that are defending the shipwrecks.
We should ally with the Seminole tribes in this area. As well as helping us fight, they may surprise us with useful information.
Beaumont has allied with this Seminole tribe. If we destroy his trading post, we will be free to ally with them ourselves.
The old fixed gun will make quick work of Beaumont's outpost!
Amelia! The mine near your base is depleted. You'll need to collect coin from the shipwrecks.
This swamp was the 'Lake of the Moon?'
I don't see any 'Fountain of Youth,' but the area is littered with doubloons from that old Spanish treasure fleet.
It looks like you're going to be sharing some of that loot, Beaumont!
All that remains is to destroy Beaumont's town center.
We've done it! Beaumont's base in this swamp is no more!
I am General Bolivar. What are you doing here? Are you with the Spanish?
No. We're chasing a Frenchman -- Beaumont. He's looking for the old Inca lands.
Troops are approaching ... but they are not attacking.
Thank you. Take these resources and use the military buildings the Spanish left behind.
I know this place. You'll never get past the Spanish.
But ... together we may be able to organize an assault. Help us rid ourselves of the Spanish and I will help you find your Frenchman.
The Spanish fort is heavily defended. Only an attack from all our forces will succeed.
There's a pass up ahead! See it?
Are you sure this is the trail?
Does it matter? We can't get back the way we came! We're going forward!
Stop that scout! If he reaches the Boneguard army, they'll be able to move forward.
The Boneguard army has beaten us to the valley.
We're running out of time. We've got to fight our way across the pass before that storm catches up with us.
If we station a soldier on an ancient ruin site he should help us see enemy positions.
We've made it to the valley!
Another scout! We need to keep him from reaching the main army.
There are bandits in these mountains as well.
Kill that Boneguard soldier before he escapes to warn the others!
We can use this cannon to try to blast a passage through that landslide. Hurry!
Maybe we can buy these bandits off. If we lure one of them to the ore nearby, they will let us pass.
We need to engage each group of Boneguard enemies to defeat them.
We need to set up an ambush for the next group of Boneguard. We should put soldiers who can attack at range along these cliffs, and then lure our enemies down the canyon.
We need to use our cavalry to destroy that cannon. The rest of this group should be easy enough to defeat.
That bandit enclave is too strong to fight. Tribute all of our coin to them to buy them off.
Amelia, the storm is coming -- we have got to hurry.
Another wave of enemy soldiers is coming.
The enemies are bringing cannon -- send your cavalry to destroy them.
A group of our brave warriors has returned from patrol -- use them where they are needed most.
We've got to strengthen the defenses of this Inca city however we can!
Our cannon are on their way -- you have to hold out until they reach us!
Protect our approaching cannon from enemy patrols!
They've destroyed one of the sacred Inca temples.
They have destroyed another Inca temple.
If our enemies destroy all of the temples, the Inca will lose the city and all hope.
There is only one Inca temple left in the city -- it must not fall!
Mmm ... you've walked right into my trap, cheri!
Looks like you could use some help.
Lay siege to the Ossuary! Beaumont is ours!
We've got to hold out until the American fleet arrives!
Send for reinforcements from the Home City.
We should ally with the natives in the area.
We might want to build an outpost near the native villages to help protect our trading post.
Call for reinforcements from the Home City.
We should ally with the natives in the area.
We'll need to build a trading post near the native villages to get them to ally with us.
Send for reinforcements from the Home City.
We should ally with the natives in this area.
We will need to build outposts near the native villages to get them to join us.
We've got to train more military.
Destroy the enemy outpost and build one of our own. The natives will ally with us then.
Sir, we have spotted a native village.
Send out some scouts. See if there are any natives we can ally with in the area.
Your precious knights are weak, Frenk!
Your ships will be reduced to flotsam against my cannon!
Surrender now, Morgan! You have no chance.
You and your band of misfits will be wiped from the New World, Morgan!
The New World is no place for cowards!
You've stolen my finest cannon, but no matter -- I'll destroy you another way.
The Fountain belongs to the Circle of Ossus now, Black.
No! Morgan seeks to destroy the Fountain -- stop him!
The Circle of Ossus shall take over the entire New World!
You and that savage have no chance against my navy.
Colonel Washington is a fool -- and so are you to ally with him.
So Washington has sailed one of his barges up river to help you. I'm unimpressed.
Colonel Washington's boats will be sunk by my navy!
I have nothing to fear from you -- either by land or by water!
The savages living around these lakes fight for me!
Fluyt. Slow, powerful ship resistant to building fire that can train units.
Galley. Good at exploring, fishing or transport.
Galleon. Slow, powerful ship resistant to building fire that can train units.
This tech doesn't do anything yet!
The boots of El Pollo Guapo, which increases speed of whomever picks them up by %2.2f%%.
%s has recovered the boots of El Pollo Guapo, which increases speed by %2.2f%%.
The cuirass of El Pollo Guapo, which increases Explorer or Hero hitpoints by %2.2f%%.
%s has recovered the cuirass of El Pollo Guapo, which increases hitpoints by %2.2f%%.
The morion of El Pollo Guapo, which increases Explorer or Hero hitpoints by %2.2f%%.
%s has found the morion of El Pollo Guapo, which increases hitpoints %2.2f%%.
The shield of El Pollo Guapo, which increases Explorer or Hero hitpoints by %2.2f%%.
%s has recovered the shield of El Pollo Guapo, which increases hitpoints by %2.2f%%.

A supply of manioc root (cassava) worth %1d %2s.
A supply of maple syrup worth %1d %2s.
A grove of chile peppers worth %1d %2s.
The journal of El Pollo Guapo worth %1d %2s.
%1s has found the journal of El Pollo Guapo worth %2d %3s.
The rutters of El Pollo Guapo worth %1d %2s.
%1s has found the rutters of El Pollo Guapo worth %2d %3s.

%1s has found the lost blanket of Empress Zoe worth %2d %3s.
The armor of Arkantos, which increases Explorer or Hero hitpoints by %2.2f%%.
%s has recovered the legendary armor of Arkantos, which increases hitpoints by %2.2f%%.
A grove of bois d'arc trees worth %1d %2s.
%1s has found a grove of bois d'arc trees worth %2d %3s.
A stand of redwood trees worth %1d %2s.
A chest of pirate gold worth %1d %2s.
%1s has unearthed a chest of pirate gold worth %2d %3s.
Ships a Fort Wagon to the New World, allowing you to construct a mighty Fort.
This treasure has already been claimed.
This treasure has already been claimed.
A northern conifier such as spruce or fir. Harvest for Wood.
Colony Wall. Places a wall around your colony.
Building a colony wall is currently unavailable.
A northern conifier such as spruce or fir. Harvest for Wood.
Allows you to research special Native technologiess.
Ranged Attack Mode is currently unavailable.
This unit is currently in Ranged Attack Mode.
Melee Attack Mode is currently unavailable.
This unit is currently in Melee Attack Mode.
Sharpshooter Mode. Increased attack, but no movement.
This unit is currently in Sharpshooter Attack Mode.
Sharpshooter Attack Mode is currently unavailable.
Enemy units are too close for walls to be built.
Herd animal. Fattens over time. Fattens faster if tasked on a Livestock Pen.
Find and ally with at least two local Natives.
Find and destroy the Ottoman Command Post and Town Center.
You get a Shipment of Native Warriors from each different allied tribe.
I need you to go to the New World, Morgan.
You sail with the tide. We'll send you resources and men once you arrive.
Select the transport unit that you want this unit loaded on at the beginning of the scenario. Press ESC to cancel.
Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
War Wagons are now available in the Riding School.
Ransom your Explorer back to this building.
You have no fallen Explorer to ransom.
You can now train more Coureurs once you research French-Indian Friendship.
Taiga trees such as spruce or larch. Harvest for Wood.
%1s has been retrieved from your fattened, and sadly, now exploded %2s.
Elite swordsmen of the Circle of Ossus.
Strike Mode. Increased speed and lower damage, except against Pikemen.
This unit is currently in Strike Mode.
Assault Mode. Decreased speed but gains splash damage.
You cannot recover this Treasure until its guardians are defeated.
%1s has reached a Level %2d Home City.

language.string: XP: %1d. %2d more XP needed for Level %3d in your Home City.
A patch of petunia flowers worth %1d %2s.

%1s has recovered a jade-encrusted jaguar skull worth %2d %3s.
A burrow full of armadillos worth %1d %2s.
Fast but expiring source of Coin.
Mines must be built near ore deposits.
Only one Mine can be built near an ore deposit.
Build your Mine near this ore deposit.
This building is too close to other colony buildings.
Great Plains: home of many Natives and plenty of Food.
Large flightless bird. Harvest for food.
Small pig-like critter. Harvest for Food.
A tame cougar who is good against guardians.
A pet grizzly bear who loves salmon and is good against guardians
A pet polar bear who loves to eat baby seals and is good against guardians
Big Jerome the Tame Polar Bear
A tame wolf who obeys you and is good against wild predators.
Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
A stray dogie (Cow) you can capture.
All your infantry march faster, but cost slightly more from now on.
Villagers gather Coin from Mines faster.
Villagers gather Coin from Mines faster.
Harvest for Food with Fishing Boats.
Uhlan attack and hitpoints greatly increased.

Rockies: teams are separated by a resource-rich valley.
California: a wide variety of terrain, from beaches to mountains.
Caribbean: a collection of islands in warm ocean waters.
Sonora: cliffs and valleys, and a winding trade route.
Great Lakes: large lakes surrounded by a single circular trade route.
Mortars are now available in the Cannon Works.
Explorer Dog. Your Explorer's loyal companion.
Your Explorer now has a loyal, canine companion.
Patagonia: continent with Trade Routes, but no Natives.
Andes: The Inca can prove a powerful ally, but watch out for the warlike Huari.
The strict Maya calendar lets villagers gather Food from hunting or farming faster.
Livestock fatten faster when tasked on a Pen. Trains Sheep.
Bonds of loyalty let you train Cree Trackers out of your Barracks or Blockhouse.
Arid trees such as juniper or mesquite. Harvest for Wood.
Arid trees such as juniper or mesquite. Harvest for Wood.
A tree such as birch or maple. Harvest for Wood.
The Ottomans have mustered the mighty Tufanci Corps!
Porcupines whose valuable quills are worth %1d %2s.

A den of skunks whose pelts are worth %1d %2s.
%1s has discovered skunks whose pelts are worth %2d %3s.

A store of lodgepole pine worth %1d %2s.
A tree such as maple or white pine. Harvest for Wood.
A tame coyote who is good against guardians.
Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
Portuguese Musketeer attack and hitpoints greatly increased.
Using Lakota methods, you are able to mount your cavalry more quickly, which trains them faster.
Trees such as oaks or mesquite. Harvest for Wood.
Upgrade the Trade Route. Upgraded routes provide resources more often because the trade units move faster.
You have mustered a regiment of Crossbowmen!

Repair Colony Walls. Patches holes and repairs damage in your walls. You can use this command whenever your walls are damaged.
Repairing colony walls is currently unavailable.
A building that heals nearby units.
Queen Elizabeth is sending you across the sea to claim the New World for the British. But first you must name the Explorer who will lead the mission.
Outposts get a cannon attack and more hitpoints.
A stand of the sacred canelo tree worth %1d %2s.
%1s has discovered a stand of the sacred canelo tree worth %2d %3s.

The walls do not need to be repaired.
This treasure has already been claimed.
This treasure has already been claimed.
This treasure has already been claimed.
This treasure has already been claimed.
Perfidious %s has BROKEN THE TREATY! Now all players are free to attack one another!
You have BROKEN THE TREATY with the other team and can now attack them!
They're headed east, and Warwick has marked the way for them.
If you build a Trading Post here, you can get line of sight and generate XP and other resources.
"These are our lands, but we will permit you to build a Trading Post here to forge an alliance between our people."
Pampas: a long grassy plain divided by a river with shallow crossings.
%s has BROKEN THE TREATY! Now all players are free to attack one another!
Break your treaty to attack one another.
Treaties are broken. Prepare to fight!
Left-click to create cliffs. Right-click to sample terrain height. Press ESC to cancel.
Click this button to see your Home City expedition units.
This treasure has already been claimed.
This treasure has already been claimed.
Create an Army with these units.
Ships 8 Middle Guard Grenadiers from the motherland. Any remaining Young Guard are upgraded to Middle Guard.
Ships 15 Old Guard Grenadiers. Any remaining Middle Guard are upgraded to Old Guard.
Do you want to save your game before returning to the Grand Conquest Strategic Map?
This is a test of the emergency broadcast system. This is only a test.
It wouldn't be Age of Empires without berries.
Set the military unit gather point.
Set the economic unit gather point
You have no territories adjacent to that territory.
Blockhouses get a cannon attack and more hitpoints.
You can see everything your enemies can see!
Special beer brewed from the poisonous Cassava root give your soldiers strength. Archer or hand infantry attack increased.
Ship resources back to your Home City. In return, your team's Imperial Army is available 1 Year sooner.
Villagers gather Coin from Plantations faster.
Villagers gather Food from hunted animals faster.
%s has placed a blockade on the Home City of all your enemies!
%s has placed a blockade on your Home City!
Set up a blockade on enemy Home Cities, preventing them from getting any shipments!
You have reached the Colonial Age!
You have reached the Fortress Age!
Increases the build limit on all warships such as Caravels, Frigates and Monitors.
Balloons can be produced from the Town Center and sent aloft to provide a huge line of sight. They cannot move once deployed and have no attack.

Mercenaries are elite troops that can be sent from the Home City for a Coin cost. Once a group of Mercenaries is hired, by any player in the game, those Mercenaries are unavailable for the rest of the game.
Villagers gather Food from hunted animals faster.
Villagers gather Food from Mills faster.
Villagers gather Wood from trees at a faster rate.
Factories can be built in the Industrial Age and produce either Food, Wood or Coin automatically.
With this upgrade, you are able to get the Treaty and Alliance upgrades at the Trading Post, which allow your Native Allies to send you free warriors.
Privateers are mercenary ships that produce Coin when they damage enemy units.
Hiring Mercenaries costs less resources. Remember, each type of Mercenary unit can only be hired once per game.
Fishing Boats gather Coin from Whales faster.
Every game, your Town Center has more hitpoints and you can further upgrade its combat effectiveness with the Fixed Guns improvement. In addition, your minutemen are stronger.
Villagers gather Coin from Mines faster.
Villagers gather Coin from Plantations faster.
Villagers gather Coin from Plantations faster.
More expensive than a normal House. Supports 10 population.
Villagers gather Coin from Plantations at a faster rate.
A German villager that is more expensive but gathers faster than a Settler.
Transform your Covered Wagon into a Town Center.
Move to an unobstructed area to transform your Covered Wagon into a Town Center.
Monitor. Mortar ship good at bombarding buildings at great range.
Send 1000 Coin back to Europe in return for 500 Experience.
Send 1000 Coin back to Europe in return for 500 Experience.
You have reached the Industrial Age!
A friendly seal. Club him on the head for Food.
Task on Ice or Rock Bridges to cause them to collapse. Has ranged and hand attack.
%1s has discovered an adorable kinkajou worth %2d %3s.
%1s has discovered the dread two-toed sloth worth %2d %3s.
%1s has discovered the giant anteater worth %2d %3s.
%1s has caught the elusive jackalope worth %2d %3s.
The spoor of the legendary sasquatch worth %1d %2s.
%1s has sighted the legendary Sasquatch. Tales of this experience are worth %2d %3s.
The attractive, but odd-looking roseate spoonbill worth %1d %2s.
%1s has discovered the roseate spoonbill worth %2d %3s.
A natural formation of rock and ice.
Organ Gun attack and hitpoints increased.
Ottoman light artillery. Good against infantry.
Cancel the repair on this building.
Assault Mode. Extra damage at the cost of reduced speed.
Defend Mode. Units protect friendly units in the defend area and stay where you put them.
Expensive but powerful villager who gathers fast.
Exports of chocolate provide you with Crates of Coin from your Home City. You get 1 Crate per 2 minutes of game length.
Turns Champion Aztecs into Garland Warriors.
Turns Champion Caribs into the mighty Feast Warriors.
Cherokee literacy lets Cherokee villagers work closely with you. You get a shipment of four Settlers.
Mastering the Comanche trade language means all your research items cost less Coin.
Tupi slash-and-burn techniques lets you clear land quickly and cheaply. All your buildings cost less Wood.
Your spies have been sent out to watch enemy positions.
%s has infiltrated your ranks with spies and now knows all that you do.
Every moment I live... is agony.
Allows you to support 100 population without the need for Houses or Town Centers (total population is not increased).
Villagers gather Food from Mills much faster.
Explorer attack and hitpoints greatly increased.
Your Home City has sent provisions to help establish your colony.
Purchases all remaining improvements for Artillery.
Native American Warrior attack and hitpoints greatly increased.
Ships an army of Highland Mercenaries: Highlanders, Swiss Pikemen and Hackapells.

Mercenaries are elite troops that can be sent from the Home City for a Coin cost. Once a group of Mercenaries is hired, by any player in the game, those Mercenaries are unavailable for the rest of the game.
Ships a number of Mediterranean Mercenaries: Stradiots, Mamelukes and Corsairs.

Mercenaries are elite troops that can be sent from the Home City for a Coin cost. Once a group of Mercenaries is hired, by any player in the game, those Mercenaries are unavailable for the rest of the game.
Ships an army of Asian Mercenaries: Manchu Horse Archers and Ronin Samurai.

Mercenaries are elite troops that can be sent from the Home City for a Coin cost. Once a group of Mercenaries is hired, by any player in the game, those Mercenaries are unavailable for the rest of the game.
Only Miners can work on these to cause them to collapse.
Only Miners can work on these to cause them to collapse.
Before 10 Great Cannon get through, force the Russian's through the north pass.
Use your Miners to collapse the Rock Bridges.
Only your Miners can work Rock Bridges. Task them on the end pieces of the Bridges. Collapsing them will seal off that pass. The Great Cannon will be forced to take another pass.
Rerouting the Cannon will help beat this scenario. Each Cannon you destroy will give you Experience. This Objective can be completed many times.
Nootka warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
Click on this button to view your objectives.
A natural formation of rock and ice.
Abus Gun attack and hitpoints increased.
Hold off the Russian army for three minutes
John Black needs three minutes time before he can detonate the explosives and bring the mountain down on the Russian army.
These miners have volunteered to help us.
More miners are ready to join the fight.
We can collapse the rock bridges and seal these passes off ... if you can keep the Russians from killing us of course.
I'll set explosives on the mountain to the north. Seal off the other passes and force the Russians to march through the northern pass.
Ships 11 powerful gun-armed riders from the Order of the Tower and Sword.
Order of the Tower and the Sword
Increases your Settler limit from 45 to 70.
"That's the last time I take Joe to buy frames with me."
Villagers (and Banks, if you have any) gather Coin from all sources much faster.
Arid trees such as Aruacaria. Harvest for Wood.
You are already in a Custom Game.
Commander of the Knights of St. John on Malta.
Leader of a large group of Caribbean pirates.
Leader among the Knights of St. John on Malta.
Famous Ottoman leader known as "the Falcon."
John's uncle. Fat men are usually jolly, but he's just cowardly.
British officer from Virginia. Great things await him.
Build a Trading Post at the Lakota village.
Destroy Warwick's Outpost on Barren Hill.
You may want to bring a significant army with you if you attack the Trading Post.
The only place to build a Trading Post at a Lakota village is in the south.
Bring the White Buffalo from Warwick's pen to the Lakota village.
Destroy Warwick's Trading Post on the Trade Route.
Claim the lost gold on Owl Island.
Find and return the Lakota chief's daughter to the Lakota village to the south.
Herd five wild horses to the Lakota tribe to the south.
Owl Island is located in the northwest. You may want to search the shoreline for a way to get across. Settlers will be able to gather the gold once you are on the island.
Defeat the guards around the White Buffalo's pen to free it, then bring it to the Lakota village on the south end of the Great Plains.
The Lakota chief's daughter may need an escort to be returned safely to the south Lakota village.
Barren Hill is located to the northeast.
Wild horses can be found scattered at various places on the Great Plains.
A second chief has been killed by the Boneguard!
The third chief of the Plains has been killed by the Boneguard. Only two remain.
The fourth tribal chief is gone. We must complete our mission before the last chief is killed.
The fifth chief has fallen. We have failed.
The Great White Buffalo is sacred. Rescue it from Warwick and return it to the Lakota village.
You have done it! You have won the respect of the people of the Great Plains.
Earn 10,000 Experience before the Circle kills all five Chiefs.
Earn Experience to help the people of the Great Plains.
A chief among the Great Plains Native Americans.
A mysterious white animal. Servant of the Circle or beast of legend?
Destroy Warwick's navy and his Town Center.
Destroy the three Boneguard outposts before Warwick's navy reaches Lake Erie.
Washington's Imperial navy will be a great help in destroying Warwick's ships. Once the enemy ships are destroyed it will be easy to take a land army in to attack Warwick's Town Center.
Less than a mile distant. I can hear them.
We need to train an army and attack the British from our side.
Try and keep up the attacks, Kanyenke -- the British keep retreating to defend themselves.
Train an army and attack the British from the south side.
Use forces from the north and south sides to destroy the British Town Center,
Destroy all the British buildings to unite Kanyenke and Nonahkee.
If the British attack the Iroquois, you may need to attack from the south side to draw attention. Start gathering resources to build a Barracks and a Stable to train units from.
You can train Mantlets out of the Trading Post in the Iroquois village. Mantlets are excellent unit for taking down buildings.
Advance to the Fortress Age and build an Artillery Foundry.
Remember you will need a reserve of Food and Coin to advance to Fortress Age.
This is the only remaining daughter of the Lakota Chief. She has a great personality.
We must gain the respect of the people of the plains before all of their chiefs are killed by the Boneguard!
The Lakota people will join you!
One of the tribal chiefs has been killed! We must hurry.
Left-click to select a target location.
A mountainous tree such as spruce or aspen. Harvest for Wood.
A mountainous tree such as spruce or aspen. Harvest for Wood.
Defend the colony at all costs.
Defend your Town Center for 15 minutes.
Improve your Walls and Outposts to hold off the Cherokee attacks. Train military as fast as you can! You can send more units and resources from your Home City.
Escort the refugees back to the colony.
Any refugees that make it back to the fort will arm themselves and become Skirmishers to help defend the colony.
Would you like to copy up your AI saved games?
Destroy Warwick's Town Center inside his stronghold.
Destroy Warwick's Trading Post at the Comanche village.
You cannot train Settlers. Capture Supply Wagons and move them to your Town Center to get more resources. But do not wait too long -- Warwick's stronghold grows more powerful over time.
The Comanche village is located to the northeast.
To collect resources from a Supply Wagon, defeat all of a Wagon's escort guards, then move the Wagon near your Town Center.
To collect resources from a Supply Wagon, maintain more units around the Wagon than your opponent, then move it near your Town Center.
To capture a supply wagon, we must defeat the escort guards around it.
Bring the captured supply wagon back to our town center.
We must drive this captured supply wagon back to our town center.
Bring John and Kanyenke to the main Cherokee village to negotiate a peace.
Establish a new colony and defeat the British.
Use your army and the Mercenaries you have to destroy the special Cherokee War Huts. War Huts are different from the Cherokee villages.
Select John and Kanyenke and have them move to the only Cherokee village. The flare indicates where this village is. If John or Kanyenke are down you will need to revive them first.
Use the Covered Wagon to build a Town Center. You will need to start training a pretty good size force because the British are going to push back with a force of their own.
Defeat the Cherokee war parties and negotiate peace.
Meeting place for all the Cherokee chiefs and warriors.
This Wagon is carrying Food. Move it to your Town Center.
This Wagon is carrying Wood. Move it to your Town Center.

Help destroy the British on your side of the river.
You will need to move fast and destroy all the British units that are attacking the French. What you save will be yours to use to destroy the British across the river.
Help the French defeat the British.
Find and destroy the British Fort Command building.
The British Fort Command is in the center of the British Fort. They are built up as much as the French are so you will need sizable forces to attack their Fort.

Grants for free improvements that increase the combat ability of Walls, Outposts, Blockhouses and Forts.
Surgeons are now available at the Cathedral.
With this upgrade, 3 improvements become available: Fortified Outposts (or Blockhouses), Cannon Bastions (towers), and Star Forts.
Enter adjustment values for each side of the map (in meters).
Click this button to build a new Covered Wagon in the New World.

A Cherokee horse archer. Good against cavalry.

He sent his soldiers here, asking for you, promising silver and horses if we would turn you over to him. We sent him away.
I fear more warriors are gathering at the war camps.
Then maybe it's time we took the fight to them.
Stuart, you stay here with the other women.
Yes, I think my skills are best put to use here.
The British are defeated! The base is ours!
Get that covered wagon to safety! We'll use it to build a new town center.

The only way to your sister's village is through the British.
The British are attacking the village. We should attack from our side now!
Sir, one of our scouts has spotted a British fort.

%s's colony has reached the IMPERIAL AGE!
Kills treasure guardians in one shot.
Fire on a target with all guns!
Ships 26 Roger's Rangers (Skirmishers) from the frontier.
The Ottomans have mustered the mighty Tufanci Corps!
Ships 8 Black Watch Highlanders from the homeland.
Ships 10 of the famed Wild Geese (mercenary cavalry) from the homeland.

Take Black's uncle to our western fort. He will tell me where the Fountain of Youth is before he dies.
Get this supply wagon back to camp. We're going to need the resources to attack that fort.
We're too late. Warwick's fort is too well defended now.
Fine job men. We've destroyed Warwick's fort in time
We have all the settlers we're going to get. For resources we'll have to steal some of Warwick's supply wagons.
If we don't get that fort down in a hurry it will be too well defended to destroy.
Deliver Home City Shipments to this building.
Home City Shipments will arrive at this building.
Your Explorer has just set foot on the shores of the New World.
To move your Explorer, you must first select him. Left-click the Explorer to select him now.
Remember, left-click to select a unit.
Now, with the Explorer selected, right-click on the ground near the flag to move him.
Remember, after units have been selected, right-click to move them.
Your soldiers have disembarked and are ready for your orders.
To select all the Musketeers at once, drag a box around them.
Remember, left-click and hold in the main game window, then drag a box around a group to select them.
Perfect! Now, right-click the ground near the flag.
The Musketeers have joined your Explorer, and you are now ready to begin exploring.
Select all four units by dragging a box around them.
Now right-click the ground near the next flag to move further inland.
Your units are nearing the edge of the screen.
Moving your cursor to the edge of the screen will scroll the view in the main game window.
Try this now. Scroll the view to the left until you see the next flag.
Remember, to scroll the view, move the cursor to the very edge of the screen.
Move your Explorer and the Musketeers to the next flag.
As your units move deeper into the wilderness, notice that more and more of the landscape is revealed.
Once your units have explored an area, you will always be able to see the terrain, but you will only be able to see enemy troops if you have units near them.
The Town Center is the first building in your new colony.
When a game begins, you will receive several Settlers and crates of resources at your Town Center.
Resources are used to construct additional buildings and train soldiers.
Your Settlers will immediately start gathering resources from the crates, but you can redirect them if you like.
Try this now. Select a Settler.
Now right-click on one of the flashing trees.
Good job. The Settler will now gather Wood from the tree.
Settlers can also gather Food from animals and Mills, and Coin from Mines.
You'll need to gather all three resources if your colony is going to survive.
That sound, and the flashing Shipment icon, indicate that you may now send a Shipment from the Home City.
Click on the flashing Home City button now.
During a game of Age of Empires III, visit the Home City now and then to send Shipments of resources, Settlers, or soldiers.
The timer above the Mini Map at the lower left of the screen shows how long it will take until you advance to the Colonial Age.
While you're waiting to advance to the Colonial Age, click the flashing button to return to the New World, and continue gathering resources and exploring.
You have reached the Colonial Age!
Build a Barracks to help defend your colony.
Now place the Barracks somewhere near your Town Center.
It would be wise to train some additional soldiers to protect the colony.
For the purposes of this tutorial, you have been given some extra resources.
Now click the flashing Musketeer button five times.
You are now training a small group of Musketeers.
Continue to gather resources and explore.
That sound means your Musketeers are ready -- and just in time too!
Spanish cavalry are on the way to raid your colony!
To attack the cavalry, select the Musketeers, then right-click the enemy units.
Remember, to attack an enemy, select soldiers, then right-click the enemy units.
You have defeated the enemy cavalry and successfully defended the colony!
Congratulations! You're now ready to go on to the second tutorial, called "Try a Game."
Cover Mode. Extra protection from ranged units.
He won't trouble your Iroquois friends again.
He's gone west towards Lake Huron, with a handful of traitors.
Ally with any other Iroquois in the area.
You are already allied with Nonahkee's village. There may be other Iroquois in the area that could help you defeat the British.
Warwick's Outposts are located along the canyons the Supply Wagons travel.
Stop the Cherokee attackers from destroying the village to the southwest.
Respond quickly to try and save the village from the Cherokee attackers. Any survivors will join your cause.
The Cherokee are attacking that village. We should help them!
I don't know but they're not peaceful anymore! Prepare the defenses! We have to hold off the Cherokee until reinforcements arrive.
We're too late. They've destroyed the entire village.
But she decides who she loves, and I will not come between you.

Allows you to send the Philosopher Prince, who advances you to Colonial Age and makes archaic units (longbows and pikemen) better.

This tech doesn't do anything yet!

Upgrades this Trade Route to use Trains, which deliver resources faster and provide more line of sight.
If the Russians can move their artillery past the mountains, we will not be able to stop them!

Trading Posts are cheaper, stronger and gain an attack.
Diverse tropical trees including palms and strangler figs. Harvest for Wood.
Aztec warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
Carib warrior attack and hitpoints increased.
