You are doomed. You have foolishly made me, your enemy.
You would settle for the kind of puny victory you get by waiting out a timer? I am almost ashamed to be fighting you.
You think just because a few ragged native tribes have joined your side you'll be able to field a more effective army? Well ... perhaps you are right.
Your multiplicity of trade routes shows that you waste your time on trivialities. I stick to the essentials.
Ha! I knew you wouldn't be able to pull it off! Now the REAL fight begins.
Here is good hearty Russian food to fortify your nation.
What?! My native allies! You will pay for this!
How can you fight on when I am able to destroy your town centers as I please?
Ah, I love the smell of burning trading posts.
My native warriors can easily trounce yours. Especially since you do not have any yet, you fool.
This trade route will carry my nation directly to your vulnerable heart.
Building walls I see. You are wise to fear me.
A true soldier never walls in.
You won't hold that native village for long. I will see to that.
You may have built on the first trade route, but you have not built the last.
What?! My native allies! You'll pay for this!
The endless taiga of Russia is filled with trees. Here is wood from it to boost your might.
I needed that trading post! You will be sorry you attacked it.
Too bad. Now I will have to crush you the old-fashioned way.
By raising the difficulty since last time, you have unleashed powerful Russian forces you did not expect!
Weakling! I see you needed to play at a feebler difficulty level. This indicates that I should have an easy victory over you.
Ha ha! The final nails in your coffin are being hammered in right now.
It is all over but the victory parade now. Ha!
Trying to steal my loot, eh? I have taught your thieving troops a lesson.
Your puny effort to raid my town is futile.
I will not let the foe destroy this building!
Your men seem to lack direction. Where are they going?
Your explorer cannot remain concealed from me!
It will be a pleasure to crush you beneath my boot heel.
This kind of a fight suits me just fine. Lots of wild action. Spread death, my men!
Good, good. Wall in - that will free up extra troops that you can take to the enemy's town.
Those walls should stop all but the most vigorous enemy assault.
The British are no better than dead dogs by now.
The British soldiers are strong ... perhaps too strong.
Soon we will be able to finish off the Netherlands contingent.
My men will die rather than let this post fall to the foe.
The French are helpless before us.
The French are a dangerous foe. We must be ready for them.
We Russians have long hated the Germans. It feels good to see them doing down before us.
We Russians have long hated the Germans. It is like drinking poison to see them doing so well.
We have almost wiped out the Ottomans. If only getting a warm water port for Holy Mother Russia would be so easy back in Europe.
We Russians have been fighting the Turks for centuries. Who knows better than us how difficult they are to beat?
A few more hammerblows and the Portuguese will be out of this game.
The Portuguese ... I had never dreamed that such a small nation could hold such dangerous soldiers.
Ha! Now we see at last who is the REAL Tsar of all the Russia!
It is too bad that we are opposed by my brother Russians. It makes the fight less of a massacre than I prefer.
So bold. But they do not expect me to attack HERE!
This native village is OURS. I shall keep it for us.
I knew the Spanish would not prove much of an obstacle.
The Spanish are so effective on the battlefield. Perhaps we should be focusing better on them.
The cursed enemy has somehow amassed superior forces! Hurry! Send help!
Our war is in a downward spiral. Even your strength may not be enough to counteract my weakness.
The cursed British! Can nothing stop them?
The enemy advance on every front. But the British foe is not so strong as the rest. Let us destroy him at least.
Russia is so much vaster than the Netherlands. How can the Dutch be winning?
If we do nothing, we lose. Let's hit the Dutch hard and fast and see if things look better.
The French seem everywhere at once. What can I do against such skill?
We may not win, but let us strike back! The French are our foe's weak spot. Strike!
My men will garrison this town.
The Germans. Always invading Russia. Well, Russia may lose this war, but first, let us invade the Germans for a change!
Blunderer! Knave! Not just your empire, but my own has been destroyed by your clumsiness!
Resign at once you poltroon! I am better off without your bungling!
The hated Turks! There are too many of them! At least we can go down fighting.
The war does not go well, but the Ottomans are not the ones beating us. Let us crush the hated Turks before the end.
How can a nation as puny as Portugal be so strong in war? It seems inconceivable!
Portugal is a small nation, and I hope weak. Let us aim our blows at them for now and see where it leads us.
I should have known better than to take on Russia as my enemy.
The war does not go well, but at least I have proven stronger than the enemy Russians. Let us at least strike them down before the end.
This trading post belongs to us, and us alone. I shall not relinquish it to the enemy.
Spain is far from Russia. I had never encountered them before, and neither had my troops. I am dismayed by their prowess.
I do not like the way this is going. But ... perhaps there is hope if only we can destroy the Spanish. They seem vulnerable.
We should have crushed them sooner. Now they have called on their friends for help.
Yet another army?! This may be too much for even me to handle.
Now that your men fight alongside mine, we can turn the battle's tide and crush the foeman beneath our boot heel!
Excellent! Now that our armies have joined up, the enemy has no chance here.
Hurrah! The enemy is in retreat. Now we shall strike while the iron is hot!
Now we have them where we want them! Attack, attack, attack!
Now we have the power to win this war! No mercy!
We still have the edge in this war. No thanks to you.
I can send coin to you for as long as you need it.
Must I do everything myself? I have practically won this war alone. Come now, turn things around!
I knew I could have crushed them alone, but it would have been much easier if you had helped out more.
The enemy is crushed, thanks to us. Well ... mostly thanks to you.
Now we have them! Keep up the pressure. I am proud to have you as the stronger ally!
Together we are taking the war to the enemy. At least I am able to help!
Ha! I was too strong for you so you had to call for your big brother to come help! Coward!
What is this? You need help to fight me? Can't do it alone, can you? Chicken!
Ha! Now together we will crush your puny force!
You cannot stand against us both. No human could!
Now THIS is the kind of battle I like! Vast numbers of soldiers, with a variety of commanders, all pushed together into the scrim! Have at you!
I will keep a stream of rations coming to you as long as you require it.
I see you have banded together in hopes of forestalling your doom. It will not help you. You see OUR armies have teamed up as well.
My armies ... crushed. My town ... a burning ruin. It is hopeless. I must offer my surrender.
My woodsmen will send lumber so long as you lack it.
War to the hilt! Let us combine our forces to destroy the enemy here.
The Russian bear shall hold sway here. And you too, should you accompany me.
Now is the time to unleash the dogs of war. Onward, soldiers of holy mother Russia!
Soon I shall hold sway over these natives, instead of our hated foe!
My explorer has returned! Now the enemy shall pay for his insolence.
When I wreck this trading post, the enemy will no longer have his native friends to shelter behind.
Our foe does not deserve the benefits of trade. I shall wreck his post here.
Cutting off the enemy's resources is as effective as killing his soldiers. I am going to strangle him by destroying this trading post.
My empire expands. I shall build a forward base of operations at this site.
I have commanded a base to be made here, to menace the enemy.
I am creating a town center here.
My empire will expand by constructing a new town at this place.
I need more territory under my control. I will construct a town here.
I am adding these natives to our empire.
Native soldiers will swell the ranks of my army.
I want to have natives among my troops.
I see I need the benefits of trade.
Gold is as good a weapon as a sword, sometimes.
By occupying a trading site, I can lure out the enemy's forces.
I am going to hit them where they are weakest - their settlers!
Without resources, their army withers on the vine. I am off to kill their settlers!
The Tsar of all the Russians thanks you for your help in bringing back our explorer.
I am pleased by your efforts on our behalf.
I am not ungrateful for your assistance.
Curse the enemy! He has forced me to ransom my explorer.
Congratulations in so effectively looting this New World.
Ah good. You are making fine use of your scouts.
The only thing worse than sending gold to the enemy is not having my explorer here where I need him.
The foe's puny efforts to deny us the use of my explorer have utterly failed. He is back.
As usual, the enemy's plans have been thwarted. My explorer has returned to health.
Our enemy is trying to get native help. I trust it will avail him nothing.
Even the natives won't be able to save our foe from his destined doom.
Look at this! An enemy town, but with no defending army! A meaty prize if you can take it.
The enemy does not realize we know about this town - it's devoid of protection. Let's burn it to the ground!
The fool! He has built a town without a barracks! Send in the cavalry!
No barracks? He cannot produce infantry here! Attack quickly before he realizes his blunder.
He has no stable in this town. Our artillery can bombard it with impunity!
This will get its own room in the Tsar's Palace.
I see he has no stable here. Attack at once with a barrage!
They have killed my explorer! No mercy for the villain!
Those knaves have killed my explorer. It is an insult to us both!
What an offense against nature! Those poltroons have assassinated my explorer!
This wilderness has killed my explorer!
What a deadly place this New World can be! It's put paid to my efforts to scout for the time being.
You cannot defeat me alone, so you seek native allies? They will do you no good in the end.
This town is a ripe plum for the taking.
Now I know where you are hiding. Your town shall be my prey.
Could you not see how near your ally was? You built practically on his doorstep, leaving the entire rest of the map for me to exploit!
You are doing so well, my friend. Perhaps this means you can spare a few resources for me to Age up as well?
Now that you have access to more powerful troops, my role must temporarily be that of support.
Hmm. I will not be able to Age up as quickly as you have done.
You are still in the previous Age? I hope you know what you are about.
Hurry and Age up! You need to catch up to me.
A fine job of advancement. Do not forget you will need troops to go along with your new upgrades and researches.
Leaping up in Age! Good, good. Put your technological edge to good use.
At last! We will not have to endure the contempt of our foes any longer.
You certainly took a long time to get to Colonial. I trust that means you have a huge army waiting somewhere.
I am gaining wealth for both of us.
Do you need some kind of help? You are STILL not Colonial!
What is the problem? You cannot build a good army in the Discovery Age!
I see you're still in the previous Age from me. Have you even discovered gunpowder yet?
Speed in advancement to Colonial Age will not matter in the long run.
It's about time you reached Colonial. Now you can train a few troops before I devastate your countryside.
It is astounding that anyone could advance through the Ages so slowly!
Your luck will not hold. Yes, you have acquired the first treasure, but the bulk of the rest will fall to me.
Pick up treasures while you can. When my soldiers march into your town, it will be too late.
I have vastly more loot than you. My army and economy will also be vaster than yours.
Your town is so feeble, you cannot even stop me from looting nearby treasure.
Well my little upstart, I can't buy our way out of this one.
Well my little upstart, stick with me and do as I do. Successes like these will become old-hat.
Splurge a little on some cannon and you'll see much better results on the battlefield.
The power and speed of horses on the battlefield is an amazing thing, you should try using it.
Many military conflicts are won by infantry might. If you build some more you might witness this first hand.
Ah my little upstart, you stand to lose more than you can handle
Ah my little upstart, you stand to lose more than you will gain if you pursue that fight.
If we win this conflict our enemies will surely recognize our power.
Did your scouts not warn you of the strength of my forces? Well now you know to retreat when next we meet.
My prowess on the battlefield is unmatched, it would be wise of you to respect it.
Ah, my little upstart, throwing your troops into the mouth of a lion only feeds it and makes it stronger.
As you can see, I did not become the leader of a strong nation without a strong military.
My little upstart, soon you will learn true power is earned not imagined.
Another victory for our side, soon this conflict will be over with.
If you keep following my lead your nation may become as strong as mine.
With some money in their pockets and a will to survive my soldiers can make miracles happen.
I knew if I lost that battle you would lose hope my little upstart. So I turned the tide and won it for you.
Continue with your build up my little upstart, I have this situation well under control.
My forces are well paid and well trained, this battle should be short and favor my side.
I thought about retreating to your forces before this battle but ...
Ah my little upstart, I believe you may have turned this battle in our favor.
This battle was mine to lose and with the reinforcements the enemy is bringing it looks like I shall.
Very well, I shall use my wealth to purchase many large guns.
The battlefield will be filled with my artillery and cavalry.
The battlefield will be filled with my artillery and infantry.
I know the abilities of cavalry well, I shall train many.
Yes, cavalry backed by artillery, two very expensive units, but I can certainly afford them both.
Cavalry followed by foot soldiers, I will begin training my force now.
I shall use all my resources to mass an army of foot soldiers.
I will soon have an army of infantry with some artillery mixed in for good measure.
I will build a large infantry force and protect its flanks with smaller groups of cavalry.
The wealth of my nation is being used in other ways, for now.
I regret to inform you that I can not comply
I can not do as you ask for the time being.
I know you are accustomed to seeing my great armies wielding their power on the field. But at this moment I have none.
I am prohibited from doing such things.
I do not have sufficient troops for that task.
A minor setback, we will still be victorious in the end.
The British are poor and weak, they should not be a threat for much longer.
Rebels!! Their challenge to my Dutch rule shall be over soon.
I believe the French will be nothing but a memory soon.
I would have never thought the Germans would resign so easily but I think they will be forced to soon.
The Ottomans are a worthy adversary but I think their days are numbered.
I sense the Portuguese will not last much longer.
I fear these nearby trees more than I fear those Russians.
The Spanish don't pose much of a threat anymore they should resign soon.
The British are a force to be reckoned with, I nominate you to do the reckoning.
As usual the Dutch are wealthy and near unbeatable.
We should make for the French or they might just ride right over us.
The German army is a well oiled machine, it would be wise to fear them.
As it stands right now the Ottomans may overpower us.
I do not want to believe it but the Portuguese are a worthy opponent here in the New World.
It seems the Russian forces are as fierce as their winters.
The Spanish power may be unmatched in the New World, we will need to work together to defeat them.
It seems your wealth and knowledge have surpassed mine would you mind sharing some of your good fortune?
Ah my little upstart, I hope you haven't rushed up the Age too soon, it will be some time before my technology matches yours.
I don't know how you advanced so soon but I hope you're full of surprises as good as this one.
The enemy has formed an alliance with the natives here. They will help to defeat our forces.
A powerful nation has both a strong economy and military but you need to advance an Age to even begin your military production.
I hope someday soon your nation will match mine in Age advancement.
Why are you still in that Age? Do you need resources?
Advance the Age soon, I don't want barbarians for allies.
Your quick Age advancement should strike some fear into our adversaries.
Being the first to advance an Age can be very powerful if you use your new researches and units wisely.
Wow! That was fast. Maybe I should just pay you to fight all my battles for me.
If you wish to lead a powerful nation you need to keep up with the rest us my little upstart.
Technology is the way of the future my little upstart, try not to stay in the past so long next time.
Being last to Age two doesn't prove you're the weakest, but it doesn't disprove it either.
I owe you a debt of gratitude for rescuing my explorer.
Thank you for rescuing my explorer. I just can't seem to keep him out of trouble.
My rescued explorer, myself, my nation, and his family send you many thanks for your efforts.
I have crushed the bond between our enemy and his former native allies while thwarting attempt at an easy victory.
The natives will no longer do the bidding of their evil ally.
I have driven quite a wedge between our enemy and his native ally.
My little upstart, sometimes you have to take your enemies apart piece by piece or in this case town by town ... hahaha
This town is no more, we should plan our next move.
They will get no more value from this trade post.
The enemy barely survived my attacks but in the end their native trade post is still standing.
That tyrant is more powerful than I thought and yes the enemy town still stands.
I thought I could destroy our enemies' trade post but their strength was greater than I had anticipated.
I'm not sure but I think I've lost my explorer. Oh wait! No no, he is dead again.
My explorer has been killed again, I promise if you rescue him he will be more careful in the future.
Hey my little upstart, when my explorer is up again could you leave a circle of your troops around him from now on? I'm sure he'll live longer that way.
I hope the enemy doesn't find my explorer's body or he might think I'm weak for losing units before I even face him.
My explorer has died, but not by the hand of my enemy.
Well my little upstart, I blame your lack of tactics for my defeat, I'm ready to resign at any moment.
Maybe I can pay-off our enemies so they will grant us safe passage home after I offer my surrender.
I can't deal with this matter on my own please send help.
Things are getting out of hand in this area, could you come take care of it my little upstart.
This is getting out of control! I need your troops in my town now!
The enemy forces in my town are much larger then what I have to defend with. You might consider sending reinforcements.
I looked forward to many successes with you as my ally.
It pleases me to see you are my ally, we should make short work of our enemies.
Hello my little upstart, stick by me and you'll become more powerful than you can imagine.
So you believe your skills have improved since last we met. Let's see how you fare this time and then I'll be the judge.
I'll tone things down a bit and try to be a little less competitive.
I'm still reeling from when last we met but I'm sure I'll fare much better this time with you as my ally.
You may have outscored me the last time we met but I will be the dominant player in this match.
Ah my little upstart, finally came to your senses and joined my side eh?
The last time we met your score was pretty low. I hope you've improved since then.
I see you prefer the play style this map offers which is good since I do as well.
Heed my advice this time my little upstart and we should fare much better.
Let us make sure our fate in this match is the same as the last one.
Well I paid the ransom for my explorer, let's hope he stays alive a little longer this time around.
My explorer must be a spy! He keeps dying in enemy territory forcing me to pay the enemy a hefty ransom to get him back each time.
This explorer just makes me poor and my enemies richer with each ransom.
Ha! I was able to rescue my explorer without paying his ransom.
I've rescued my explorer. Let's see how long he lives.
Well, it seems our enemy is too poor to maintain an army to defend his town. We should take advantage and strike!
My scouts tell me the enemy has no barracks in his town, cavalry should ride through it unimpeded.
Bring the big guns! Our artillery should be safe attacking the enemy's town since he has no Stable.
A wealthy nation is a strong nation, so here is some coin.
I assume you will use this food wisely.
I have all the wood I need right now, I'm sending some of my extra logs.
The enemy base here makes some of my settlers nervous so I'm going to destroy it.
My forces are on the move to the enemy base, I shall be declaring a glorious victory in the near future.
The enemy settlers are making him rich. I plan going to send a small force to take some out.
You have to hit the heart to kill the beast. I march on the enemy's main town.
Watch me take the enemy's main town my little upstart. You might learn something.
The alliance to these natives is a boost to the enemy's forces I can no longer allow him to have.
This trade post might make the enemy wealthier than me, I must destroy it.
I see you're in a fight! My troops are on the way.
Looks like you're doing well over there, but I'm sending my forces in to make sure it stays that way.
Rest easy my little upstart, my forces are en route to make sure the outcome there is in our favor.
This will be the location of my next military base.
My new town will be built in this location.
I shall form an alliance with these natives to bolster our forces.
I believe these natives will be very helpful in the future.
We Dutch are amazing traders, it only makes sense I build a trade post.
Once I finish this trade post my wealth will grow immensely.
This area has too much value, I will not let the enemy take it.
I can not allow the enemy to break our alliance with those natives, my forces will protect that area.
My forces will protect this town.
I will not let the enemy take this trade post.
Feel good knowing that Dutch coin will continue to flow into your coffers.
Your people should never go hungry with this food I'm sending you.
I suspect I'll see a whole new colony soon from the wood I'm sending you.
Hold on! My troops are on the way.
I see you're having trouble defending yourself my little upstart. Don't worry my forces are en route.
I'm ready to send troops there to help turn back the enemy.
It's been quiet, maybe too quiet.
Hope all is well over there, all is fine here.
Did you know my father was called "the Silent"?
Could you spare some coin? Just this once I promise.
My people are hungry, do you have some food to spare?
I need to build a bank or something, could I have some wood?
I knew the enemy was lost once your forces showed up.
Our combined forces on the battlefield, is there a better duo?
Thank you my little upstart, your troops, although not needed, were welcomed for joining my forces in that battle.
I shall put this coin to good use.
My base survives because of you, thank you.
The goods you sent me will not go to waste.
This wood will build many great structures in my town.
Our outcome looks bleak when looking at the strength of the British player.
If anyone could put us between a rock and a hard place I should have known it would be the Dutch.
The French ride all over us as yet we can not stop them.
The Ottomans are mighty. They will surely be the cause of our demise.
(Sighs) When did the Portuguese become so tough?
Seems the Russians are as many and as strong here in the New World as they are back home.
The Spanish are everywhere. I do not know if we can defeat them.
All is not lost. The British are barely holding on.
The situation is not in our favor but the Dutch are conformable.
We need to turn the tide of this contest but I sense the French are no real threat to us.
It seems the Germans are lost and sputtering out of control.. Through them we might be able to change our future.
The enemy seems too strong but I think the Portuguese are their weak link.
We may be behind right now but the Russians shouldn't last much longer.
We're not doing so well but the Spanish are doing even worse.
Please forgive me, I fear I will be the cause of our great alliance not prospering as it should.
You are the pinnacle of our strength my little upstart. But I'm not sure you'll be enough to get us out of this one.
Looks like the end is near, I do not think my strength is enough to hold for the both of us.
I will have to train you to be more my equal so that we may crush our enemies instead of them crushing us.
It seems you're keeping up with me quite well my little upstart. The enemy no longer has the strength to stand up to our power.
This alliance has brought me great prosperity. You're better than I imagined you could be.
Looks like I will ride to glory again, on your coattails of course.
It's okay your nation isn't as strong as mine, I'll take us both to victory.
Don't worry my little upstart, I'm doing well enough for the both of us.
This battle is lost, if we resign now perhaps we can fight together another day.
We fought the good fight but we've been beaten.
All is lost, let us resign and take them on again.
We've missed our chance at victory. Let us resign and fight again.
They have forged the first alliance with the natives here but it will be their last.
The enemy is looking to increase their wealth by building on a trade site.
They are forging more native alliances. We might see more native warrior on the field they we can handle.
They've built another trade post, they must be stopped.
Good move, your natives will surely help crush our enemies.
I'm sure the enemy is quite jealous of your new trade post.
Nice work! That treasure should be helpful.
Resources and units from treasures are always A nice bonus.
Extra coin to your coffers. Spend it wisely.
You should use that food to build more settlers and expand your economy.
You must be a skillful leader to take such advantage of the treasures around you.
As long as you put that treasure to good use I won't mind you taking it from my lands.
Native warriors, a welcome addition to any army.
Extra settlers should really help to get your economy going.
Extra wood is never a bad thing to have.
Having the upper hand with the natives in this region definitely favors our side.
Having more trade sites helps create a wealthier nation and I believe a wealthy nation is a strong nation.
Wall defenses should hold the enemy back for a time.
Are you getting scared my little upstart? Don't fret, my forces will protect you as well.
It seems our enemy underestimates the power of these natives, but I do not.
Like a good businessman a leader must look for ways to improve his wealth and that's what this trade post will do for me.
What's this? My explorer has done something useful. Haha!
I will use this treasure to strengthen both our nations.
These treasures are very useful. Do you see some more?
The rich just keep getting richer.
This extra food will help feed my nation.
I have been eyeing this treasure for some time now. Since you didn't take it, I did.
You should try to find some more treasures. They're really a boost to any nation.
If you wish to be powerful and wealthy like me, you need to find more treasures my little upstart.
I shall use this Native warrior to scout and destroy our enemies.
Maybe I'll use this wood for a market or bank.
I couldn't let those tyrants have more native alliances in this region than us.
More trade sites means more wealth, and you know I like being wealthy.
The enemy forces are making me nervous so I'm putting up some walls so they cannot surprise me.
Four of a kind! Lets research the victory condition and put an end to this war.
Are you an imposter? Because your skill rating was much higher the last time we played.
I see you've been practicing my little upstart. Your skill rating is much higher than I last remember it.
I see you've gained quite a bit of experience since we played last. I hope your Home City is more powerful to show for it.
You might defeat me this time but know it won't be easy to do again.
Only 1 minute until the end. Can you feel the pressure?
What a glorious fight, many heroes will be born today.
You should turn and run, this battle does not look good for you.
Are those the only troops your nation could afford?
I'm telling you this as an enemy that respects you, you should retreat.
My ally has come to save me, don't you wish you ran while you had the chance?
I see you could not face me alone. Obviously begging your ally for assistance.
Your technological advances will not save you from the wrath of my forces.
How did you manage to Age up so quickly? You must tell me your secret.
Those natives will not be enough to stop my forces.
You have saved yourself the wrath of many native warriors by destroying that trade post.
My town center is lost but I am not.
Drat! That trade post was bringing me much wealth.
Please advance the Age, I don't want to destroy another nation of barbarians.
Are you aware of my technological advances? Perhaps you should try to catch up.
Rushing up Age will not guarantee you victory in the end.
A little slow on your Age advancement I see. Perhaps you need a minute before I attack?
Your town center is far from your ally. After I destroy this one I'm sure you'll build your next one a lot closer to him.
Building next to your ally is the best decision you've made all game, my little upstart.
Did you think I would allow you to win in such a manner?
Your native alliance was making you too powerful so I ended it for you.
Your town center is lost. You will be as well if you do not make the smart decision and resign now.
I know the wealth a trade post can provide, therefore I couldn't allow you to keep yours much longer.
A fine day for a war is it not?
If you consider resigning now I might give you 200 gold for your troubles.
No formal 'hellos' now, I'll make your acquaintance later on the battlefield.
I respect you challenging yourself by raising the skill level, but I fear the result may not be what you had hoped.
Playing at a lower skill level this time. Probably a smart choice when facing me.
I think you feel this map type helps your play, but realize it also helps mine.
It was wise of you to lessen the odds against you but I do not think you lowered them enough.
You could not stop me from rescuing my explorer and I can not stop him from destroying your town.
My explorer is up but don't worry he's not much of a threat.
I see your forces with an explorer keeping an eye for them. Well done.
I just wanted you to know that force your explorer is leading round does not scare me.
I'm warning you now, if those troops with your explorer come any closer to my town I'm going to have to take him out.
I see some of your units. They look lost. Where is your explorer?
Those troops look like an easy target for my men to train their skill.
For the safety of your own men you should keep them in your town and away from my forces.
It would be unwise of you to attack me with those forces near my base.
Only the weak prey on defenseless settlers.
You obviously need to attack settlers because my troops would cut yours to pieces.
My losses will be dwarfed compared to what I'm about to do to you!
Wow! That's an impressive force I see.
Your force is of decent size but I would advise not attacking with it.
This will not bode well for me.
Is that what you call a raid??
I have found your town. Now I know where to strike.
I have spotted your town and for now, it actually resembles mine in some ways.
Well my little upstart, if you want that town of yours to survive you should surrender it to me now.
Its unfortunate that you could not get this treasure because it sure was helpful.
Ha! My army is on your doorstep!
I am here and prepared to fight!
It is time to test your skills my little upstart, my army is upon you!
I so enjoy having time to build upon my economy.
I hope you're using this time wisely, my next attack is not too far away.
What do you do with your nation when I'm not attacking you?
You have beaten me, and I would like to offer my surrender.
I sense I can no longer obtain victory, may I resign now?
Your actions have only delayed the inevitable.
Nicely done, alliances with natives may be the path to victory in this conflict.
That trade post will not help you gain more wealth than my banks can produce.
That is only one treasure, I will find many more than that.
Do you have the wisdom to use that treasure wisely?
It is better you got that treasure or I would have too great an advantage over you.
Hmm, seems your explorer finds useful things to do with his time, unlike mine.
Will you be able to buy an army to beat me with that little bit of coin?
A little bit of food, I'm not worried.
You have an unfair advantage, your explorer is doing something useful.
I left that treasure there as a trap, now I'm going to hunt your explorer down.
Natives are good but treasure will not be enough to help you in the end.
I'm sure I could put those settler to better use in my town.
That will just give me more building to tear down.
A wise plan to wall in, but they won't be enough to save you.
I thought you were not afraid of me when we declared war on each other but these walls make me think differently.
Be careful, soon native warriors will be attacking your town.
This trade post will only add to my wealth.
My explorer must really want to destroy you because he is actually helping to victory.
I'm sorry but I could not allow you to have this treasure.
This will help me field an army greater than yours.
Why do you leave such treasures for me on your lands? I guess you know those lands will belong to me soon enough.
Is your explorer dead? I haven't seen him.
You'll see him soon ... attacking your town.
Extra settlers for a wealthy nation, this cannot fare well for you.
This wood will help me build a barracks or a bank, whichever.
That trade site will help you become almost as wealthy as me.
Trying to take the easy win condition, eh my little upstart? I'll put an end to this nonsense.
Take the peaceful way defeat and just allow this timer to run out.
What happened to your rating? Been facing more leaders like myself?
I see your rating is going up, are you ready for your next lesson my little upstart?
I hope all that experience has made your Home City more powerful than the last time we met.
The enemy will no longer benefit from this native alliance. I am going to destroy their base here.
I regret that I am not allowed to take that step.
It is impossible for me to do as you wish.
Yes I agree. Artillery backed by cavalry it is.
You are right. Artillery plus infantry should seal our enemy's fate.
Artillery is the god of the battlefield, after all.
The best generals were all artillerymen first.
My cavalry can run amuck! With some artillery pieces to back them up we shall have a fine army.
Yes, if I train cavalry - perhaps even cuirassiers - and accompany them with some infantry ... we shall see ...
The enemy's control of these natives has been a pain like a boil. I am about to lance it.
I love infantry. Their stolid relentless nature brings out the best in my artillerymen as well.
I shall train infantry! The queen of battle! With some horsemen to keep their flanks safe.
I will train the cavalry component of our joint army.
I see you have heard the reputation of the French cavalry! Soon they shall fight at your side.
Infantry has many uses. I shall train as large a force as possible.
Infantry have staying power that other units lack. I shall field as many as you need.
Now you have the economic edge over our foe.
An army travels on its stomach. It is good you found food.
What a creative way to add to your army.
I am going to deny the enemy this trading site.
We need wood as much as steel and shot.
I will take all of these I can get.
I can use this coin to pay my soldiers.
Free soldiers are always good for the soul.
I never doubted my eventual victory in that fight.
The enemy soldiers gave it their best shot, but it was not enough.
Did you watch that fight closely? You can learn something from my skill as a commander.
No more trade for the enemy here!
I thought I would win. And I did.
I wish the enemy would present more of a challenge.
The best offense is a good defense.
Walling in my main base will free up more troops for the attack.
Keep calm. All we have to do is knock out one of the enemy posts and all will be well.
We need to organize for an assault on one of the four enemy posts as soon as possible.
We have them by the nape of the neck. If they cannot break through our defenses, they are done for.
Do not relax your vigilance. The enemy will be desperate now.
Congratulations are in order, I see. Your multiplayer rating has skyrocketed since we last met.
How impressive - your multiplayer score is much higher than before.
This is the most strategic place for me to set up a new base.
I see your multiplayer score has dropped since our last session. Well, watch what I do and learn.
Your multiplayer rating is so low! I will try to teach you what I can, but it's up to you to apply it in battle.
I am happy to see that you have been building your skills and experience since we last met.
I applaud you for increasing your Home City's size so much since last time.
Something about this map seems familiar to me.
Our last fight alongside one another was a bit of a fiasco. I'm sure we will turn it around this time.
Remember what you did last time we played? We lost. So don't do that same stuff.
Remember what you did the last time we played? We won. So do the same things!
I promise to do better than last time.
Try to improve on your past skills, please.
The enemy will not like the base I'm going to construct here.
I went easy on you when we fought each other last time. Now that we are allies, I'm pulling out all the stops.
So now you seek me as an ally instead of a foeman. That is wise.
This is quite irksome. I guess we will have to seek victory the old-fashioned way.
Even though the enemy has already allied with the natives, we still have a little time before he can make that alliance effective. We must move quickly and decisively.
The enemy now has natives, unlike us. We can only hope that this alliance has overstretched them.
The enemy now has a trading post. I trust this means they will be emphasizing their shopkeepers instead of their military.
The enemy may have overstretched their resources, building that trading post so soon.
Though the enemy has more native villages on his side, we should be able to keep up with his numbers by diligently training our troops.
Why is our enemy building so many trading posts? What are they thinking?
With these extra natives, we can outfight and outtrain our enemy.
Here is my next town center.
More trading posts means more money, which can be turned into a bigger army.
We have natives now. And the enemy does not!
I am glad to see you are keeping an eye on the trading post sites.
Well, I have stopped their victory countdown. Now they will probably resort to other means.
As expected, I have claimed the first native village.
It is only logical that I should claim a trade route first.
Every trading post we build brings us closer to economic triumph.
I do not fear the outcome of this fight. Even at a higher difficulty level than our last combat, we should win.
We do not have much of a challenge ahead of us, now that you've turned down the difficulty.
Now I shall annex this land here.
There is no time to waste! Throw everything you have at the enemy trading posts or we are done for!
Victory is all but assured now. They have but one minute to stop us, and I do not think they can do it.
A single minute. Then the laurels of victory will be ours.
There is no hope for us now, my friend. I have let you down. Let us surrender while we still have a little dignity.
These natives will no longer serve the purposes of our enemy.
That is the end of that town. Let us move on to the next.
He no longer has the use of that town. It is in our hands.
Now that we have captured this area, should we build our own trading site here?
That base was too well-fortified. We will need a stronger army.
That village was surprisingly difficult to take down.
This area is rich in resources and tactically vital. I will take it.
His town has foiled us. For now.
We must try harder in the future. That trading post further strengthens our opponent every minute.
Why do you fight on? The case is hopeless. If you do not surrender soon, I may do so on my own.
Coin - your war chest can use this, can it not?
The French have the finest cuisine in the world my friend. Take these rations and see for yourself.
Wood may not be as exciting as coin or food, but it is still necessary. Take this for your coffers.
I cannot do as you request.
The critical place we must help is this spot, here.
I need your assistance - kindly send troops to this point as soon as possible.
My soldiers are already en route.
The natives here are going to assist us.
I am going to reinforce you here.
In my opinion we need more men here. I am sending them right now.
I will be there as soon as possible.
You will not lose here. I have sent a corps to back you up.
Keep it up. Soon my men will arrive and the jaws of the trap will close on the enemy army.
I have assigned a sufficient force to defend this building.
I will keep this native village out of the enemy's hands.
The enemy should not take this town. I will guard it.
This would be a dangerous spot for the enemy to build on. I will protect it.
What?! How can this be? I can't fight on without troops or resources! I tender my resignation to you.
I have fought the natives before, and they were redoubtable enemies. They will be equally redoubtable friends.
Tell me when you no longer need the extra coin, and I will stop sending it.
Ah, food cooked by French chefs. Tell me when you need no more.
Let me know when I have sent enough wood to you.
I am pleased to have an ally worthy of my prowess.
I need some coin right now. I vow it will go to good use.
Please send me some coin if at all possible.
An army travels on its stomach. Can you ship me some food?
Without wood, how can I build an empire? Do you have some wood you're not using?
Ship me some wood. Now. Er ... please?
I will form a French/Indian alliance.
They are doomed. Already I can taste victory.
Their soldiers are too few, and too badly managed. I sense victory.
See how the enemy line is already beginning to crack under my troops' hammerblows.
I could have done it without your assistance, but you did save me some time.
Working together we were able to save my base.
Perhaps I could have saved my base alone. We shall never know.
A few more victories like this, and our foe will be undone.
This is just the way I won the battle of Austerlitz.
Let us take a brief breather, and return to the fray once more.
This coin will be put to good use.
A trading post can be as strong a weapon as a fortress.
This is just what I needed.
This food is almost as good as my own chefs could cook.
This wood comes at a most opportune time.
You must be able to recognize a defeat well ahead of time, so that you can keep it as minimal as possible.
Pull back at once! The enemy is too strong here.
With artillery, war is made. You have a lack of these basic means, my ally.
Cavalry is the answer to our problems. Equip some horsemen and we can ride down the enemy.
Your army is unbalanced. You need more horsemen to balance the rest of your forces.
Infantry is the queen of battle. You have too many kings and not enough queens.
Trade brings wealth, and wealth: power.
Infantry is the backbone of any army. Your army, my friend, is practically spineless by comparison.
The situation does not look good, my friend. Perhaps we should make a dignified retreat and resign this game.
This time they have proven the stronger force. Perhaps we will defeat them next time. Shall we resign now?
A soldier will fight long and hard for a bit of colored ribbon.
You know - a throne is only a bench covered with velvet.
Death is nothing - to live defeated is to die daily.
Attack! Down with you, vile enemy!
Now you should begin to understand just how badly you have blundered.
I need money to expand my economy. Trade will do the trick.
Are your folks starving, that you would waste time looting that?
Can't train your own soldiers, so you recruit them from the wilderness?
Wood is in the trees, not laying around the ground.
More settlers means a bigger economy which means a stronger army. Too bad for you.
Wealth is the blood of nations.
More rations for my ever-growing forces.
More warriors for my army! And free ones at that!
Wood is good for natives, artillery, and necessary buildings. Free wood is best.
Can't you put up a better fight?
I go now to raid their settlers.
That battle was rather ... trivial. I kept hoping you had an interesting surprise up your sleeve. But no.
Is that it? I guess it was too much to expect you to pull off a win with those odds against you.
This war might be more interesting than I had predicted.
Nice job. I'll have to change my strategy I see.
Your multiplayer rating is much higher. I hope this means you will present an interesting challenge for me.
I see your multiplayer rating has plummeted since our last encounter. Well, watch carefully what I do and perhaps you'll learn something.
I've been idle for so long. Thanks for letting me have another chance to meet you.
Are you in a rut? This is the same kind of countryside as the last time we played!
This is going to be harder for me than the last time we met.
I respect an opponent who's willing to take on a tougher challenge than he did last game. My hat is off to you.
I am going to kill off some enemy settlers to slow their economy's growth.
Cunning of you to use map control and four trading posts to try for a victory. It won't work, however.
You may have access to more native warriors for now, but soon the situation will be altered in my favor.
Now that my explorer has been rescued, his labors will benefit us both.
You have spread yourself thin on the trade routes. I can take keen advantage of this.
The problem: too many enemy trading posts. The solution: elimination. Problem solved.
The natives don't want your burdensome rule. They'll be much better off under MY burdensome rule.
This is a decisive blow at your very heart!
This time your trading post - next time your whole empire!
With these native warriors assisting me, I can swamp you with numbers.
You are remiss, my friend. This trading post will boost my power and lead to my ultimate win.
I suppose those walls might delay the inevitable for a few short minutes.
The money you're wasting on those walls would have been better used to beef up your army.
Excellent! You have saved us from the cost of a ransom.
I had marked those natives as MY allies. I must do something about the situation.
I think by building that trading post, you have stretched your resources just a little too far.
I did not need that particular native alliance anyway.
It is most annoying, but I can survive without that trading post. For now.
You think this will stop me? It just steels my resolve.
Don't think this ends the threat to you.
Of course I always fight to the best of my ability. But now that you have increased the difficulty, my ability has risen accordingly. Beware!
Couldn't take the higher difficulties, eh? Decided to turn it down a notch?
Now the burden for action is on your shoulders. All I have to do is keep a firm grip on my trading posts and it's all over.
Just one minute ... wait! Surely you don't want it to end this way? Demolish one of your trading posts, quick! Let us end this with a bang, not a whimper.
Aha! Thanks to you, my explorer is back in action.
You fools. You thought you could defeat me. Now I am only seconds from winning.
Even over something as trivial as that treasure, I am able to give your soldiers a sound drubbing.
You'll need more soldiers than that to attack MY town.
Your troops are out in the open. Exposed.
Now that I can see where your explorer is headed, I know your entire plan.
You stand no chance against my skilled legions. Surrender now.
This fight is going to be complicated. That will give me a natural advantage.
Sometimes it is good to look to our defenses, such as walls.
I see you have walled off your base. I considered it myself.
Ha ha! Perfidious Albion will soon be no more!
I'm sure I'd be able to conquer you if we only fought a little longer. But in the interest of saving time I hereby offer to quit in your favor. Is that acceptable?
Alas! I need my explorer and we could not rescue him, so I paid a hefty ransom. At least he is back now.
Those cursed Beefeaters are proving difficult for our troops to overcome. Will it be another Waterloo?
I never did think the Dutch would offer much of a threat.
The wealth and power of the Dutch are giving them disproportionate strength.
Tres bien! We now know who is best suited to rule the French nation!
The enemy French are nearly as strong as mine. This could be a problem, my friend.
Germany was my battlefield and playground for many a year. History repeats itself.
These Germans seem strangely effective in combat. Too effective.
One Turk can beat three Frenchmen. But ten Frenchmen are a match for ten Turks. And one hundred Frenchmen can defeat any number of Turks.
The Ottomans have always been a powerful enemy. One-for-one they may be the strongest soldiers in Europe!
So much for the vaunted Portuguese. I had wondered what they would be like to fight. Mere pushovers.
I had to pay through the nose to get my explorer back. If only we could have rescued him.
The Portuguese are proving stalwart opponents. There must be something we can do about them.
The Russians are almost gone. I wish I had you by my side when I marched on Moscow in 1812, my friend.
The Russians are proving as stubborn here in the New World as they did in the Old.
The Spanish never could stand up to good French firepower.
Spain proved an annoying problem to me in 1807-1814. History seems to be repeating itself.
The enemy is too strong for me at this time. Please send help at once.
They have somehow overcome my forces. My weakness may now prove your Achilles heel.
I fear I have met another Waterloo at the hands of the hated British.
The enemy has us on the defensive. Perhaps we can at least destroy the perfidious British?
I wish the Dutch had been on our side, instead of opposed to us.
Bravo! My men have rescued my explorer.
My advice is for us to try to take out the Dutch player. Annihilate him, and we could turn this war around.
The French are, as always, redoubtable. In fact, I think they have beaten me soundly.
I no longer have confidence in our ultimate victory. But for now, the enemy French are vulnerable to a counterattack.
I do not like our prospects. But I think the Germans are the enemy's weak point.
You have betrayed our cause. I would have won if you had not dragged me down with your floundering!
So your ineptitude has brought me to this pass. Now it looks as though we might lose.
The Ottomans are so numerous and so wealthy that I see nothing we can do to turn the tide.
The Turkish empire is tottering. Let us take them down with us!
The Portuguese have long been my enemies. It seems I cannot hold them off much longer.
My explorer is back on his feet and ready for action.
The Portuguese have long been my enemies. Before we give up, let's strike at them - they may prove to be the weak point in our opponents' defenses.
The Russians are stronger than we. History repeats itself.
I perceive a weakness in the Russian foe. We may possibly be able to get out of our predicament by focusing on them and knocking them out of the war.
I am stunned that the Spanish, of all people, are proving the masters.
The weak opposing Spanish are like an ulcer in our enemy's side. Let us take advantage of their feebleness and destroy them. We may yet win this war.
We did not defeat them quickly enough. We gave them time to summon reinforcements and that could be our undoing.
We had the victory won, but now there are more of them. Do you have any reserves you could send?
It is good that your troops have come to help mine. A little longer and who knows what could have happened? I might even have lost!
I was worried about the outcome of this fight, but your men seem to have come in time to save my forces! Merci, my friend.
As I predicted, we are masters in this struggle.
The enemy has not proven able to cope with us. Now our combined forces will finish him off.
The enemy's incompetence has led him to this pass. We need only to keep doing what we have been doing so far to let victory fall into our hands.
The enemy is falling behind me. I wish you would catch up.
I realize that I could have beaten the enemy by myself, but still there was no need to put it to the test.
There is still time for you to rally your forces and participate in the final crushing of the foe. Surely you don't want me to have ALL the glory?
You are doing a terrific job, my friend. I shall strive to live up to your example.
Move onward to victory! I shall assist you as much as possible!
Your powerful army and economy have led our alliance to the verge of victory. You are a great leader.
I had you in the grasp of my hand. Do not think that just because your ally managed to save you THIS time that he will be able to do it EVERY time.
Seeking refuge under your ally's protective cloak? That won't work forever, you know.
Hmm. The enemy now has native allies. We shall have to fight all the harder.
We need to fight natives as well as our main enemy. Keep training that army of yours!
You clearly do not comprehend the value of combining your forces, and it's going to cost you this fight.
I could have defeated you alone, but my ally wished to join in the spoils. Too bad for you.
The fact you have joined up will help you no more than it helped my enemies at Austerlitz. And even better than at Austerlitz, now I have allied troops assisting me.
You have fallen into our trap! Your armies, grouped together, will now be shattered by OUR armies, grouped together. This will be one of my most glorious triumphs!
The fools! This enemy town is completely defenseless! Let us take advantage!
Strike quickly before the enemy realize how vulnerable this town is!
Our enemy has stuck his neck out - here is a town with no barracks. Send in the cavalry!
I shall start an offensive at this point.
He can't reinforce this town with infantry. Take advantage of it!
Attacking this town with artillery would be easy. He has no stable to produce cavalry.
I wonder why he has not built a stable near here? Let us take advantage of his oversight at once.
The enemy has killed my explorer. Perhaps a quick patrol could catch and kill the troops that did this.
My explorer was overbold and has paid the price.
My explorer has been slain. Yours must do double duty from now on.
My explorer lies bleeding his life out, and he was not even taken down by the enemy!
Now my explorer is hors de combat. This is not an auspicious beginning.
How pitiable ... calling upon the natives of this land for help.
The French need this area. So we shall take it.
This is a terrible place to build a town, as I will soon demonstrate.
My brilliant scouting techniques have spotted your town's center. Soon the invasion shall begin.
Towns so near to each other mean you will eat up all the nearby resources all the sooner.
Your skill in managing your town impresses me. I hope you have not done so too soon.
You advance with breakneck speed I see. That should give us a tactical edge on our common enemy.
Excellent, now that you have the technological edge, press your advantage!
Every time you get a treasure like that, it is good for both of us.
What do you think you're doing? Shouldn't you be an Age or two higher by now?
I have been in the next Age for what seems like hours. When will you follow suit?
When I capture this base, it will unravel the enemy's position.
I see you run your economy effectively. I am confident you will prove as good at warfare, no?
That was fast! I suspect it bodes well for the future of our alliance.
It's about time you managed to reach the Colonial Age with the rest of us.
Finally! It took you long enough to get here to Colonial.
I see your colony is still in the early stages of construction. Will you be able to withstand more-advanced enemy armies?
The enemy will not wait for you to get to Colonial. They'll attack when THEY are ready, not when YOU are ready.
These discoveries are fascinating. I must make more of them.
Our scholars in the Sorbonne will welcome the chance to study such things.
Ah yes, gathering riches will advance our cause.
You can take that treasure. I wasn't going to get to it until later.
We should combine our forces to destroy him at this point. I am sending my armies now.
Please be careful about where you gather your treasures in the future. I will take care of those near my own town.
How fine - already gathering your first treasures.
A fine job in making discoveries. Do not neglect your town's development however.
It is good to see you have so many treasures. You have not let your economy lag, I trust.
Can you not find the treasures scattered around the landscape?
There are treasures here, there, and everywhere. Are you blind?
I realize this discovery was rather near to your town, but it will go to a good cause.
You will need to make discoveries on your own for a time I fear. My explorer is indisposed.
The French tricolor will stand at this point before we are done. Attaque l'outrance!
I regret to report that my explorer was a bit too bold. He's dead.
Now my forces are advanced far beyond your primitive imagination.
You have fallen into my trap - advancing to Colonial too soon!
Did you wake up at last? Or were you stimulated to Age up by some kind of primeval instinct?
You are doing well, I see. Please stay in the Discovery Age for as long as possible - preferably the rest of the game.
You have nothing better to do but look for loot?
I cannot waste my efforts on picking up random treasures. I have a war to win!
You must not be very good at multitasking - I see that you have been unable to both gather treasures and try to build your town.
I think this treasure now belongs to ME.
By my calculations, the time is ripe to destroy the main enemy town here.
I regret I do not currently have sufficient resources to help you.
My resources are almost gone. I cannot do what you've requested.
My sincerest apologies, but I cannot help at this time.
I do not have any soldiers yet.
I am working on other issues at this time, so I do not have an army.
I have not yet taken the step of creating an army.
I do not have sufficient men under arms - they would just be killed to no avail.
My army is not ready to fight.
My small army would make no difference in the fight. You'll have to do it yourself until I have built up more strength.
With the bounty of the New World at my disposal, nothing can stop me
My men plunder the countryside for my glory.
Where ever I turn, I find riches to aid the French cause.
Pathetic ... foraging in the forests like a hungry peasant.
Grubbing in the dirt again? How sad for you.
I see your explorer is out frantically accumulating random odds and ends. Your settlers must be very inefficient.
Already reduced to foraging? Your settlers must be starving.
Skill in exploration will not help you in the battles to come.
You have accumulated almost no treasure. I had hoped for a more worthy opponent.
The foolishness of an inexperienced leader ... wandering so far from reinforcements.
You'll pay for stealing that treasure. And soon.
Ha! You fool, can't you even collect the treasure near your own town?
You STILL have not advanced in Age? The situation would be laughable if it were not so serious for you.
Advancing at this breakneck speed cannot be good for you in the long run - and that is when I will crush you.
Finally, signs of life. Perhaps it will at least look like I had a challenge.
Impressive technology. But can you do anything with it?
Enjoy your brief edge over me while you can.
Wasting your resources on bells and whistles I see. Aging up so early is a frivolity I can't afford.
I have found you! All that remains is to fly a French flag over that town.
You build near your ally ... a sound strategy. Now I can annihilate you both.
You build far from your ally's support. Because you are bold? Or simply foolhardy?
My explorer is free. If you'd paid attention, you could have demanded ransom.
My explorer has slipped through your clutches.
Your grip is too weak, my friend. My explorer has escaped.
I see ... you cannot train troops, so you borrow them.
I see your puny army. I guess a stealthy approach is beyond your limited capacity.
Your army is so small and quaint. It almost seems a pity to wreck it.
A tiny little army. How cute.
Now that I see your troops, I know what your plan must be.
Still letting your army wander aimlessly I see. I am sure your men wish they had a more capable commander.
You have lost the element of surprise. If I were a lesser man, I might even be afraid.
How ever did YOU come up with an army so large?
Your army is nowhere near my base. Do you know where you're taking it?
Worthwhile technique, trying to undercut my economy. More sophisticated than I would have expected from you.
While you waste precious time chasing down my settlers, my invasion army readies.
Stop that! Soldiers are meant to fight other soldiers, not civilians.
You lack finesse, yet you are somehow effective. Perhaps I have underestimated you.
Sacre bleu! Your forces ... so lethal. I demand a rematch!
I do not understand what went wrong. My unworthy subordinates must be to blame.
Another battle, another day without a challenge. (Yawn)
Once more French troops under my control prove victorious.
If you were more cunning, I'd worry about what you're planning.
Skilled commanders do not give their opponents a chance to rest. Thanks for the respite.
One misfortune should not make one lose hope.
If we cannot attack now, then it is indeed over.
We have persevered this time, my friend.
I told you that trust in me was well placed.
Take it from an Ottoman. Artillery is what you need.
Make falconets ... cannon... any kind of artillery will help you now.
Cavalry will cut them down like lions among bunnies.
Train cavalry, my friend. I do it all the time. It is very nice.
Send in swordsmen or muskets. Anything on two legs.
We Ottomans have won many battles with infantry. I suggest you try that strategy now.
The mouse who has only one hole soon gets caught. You should retreat carefully, my Ally.
No matter how far you have gone down a wrong road, turn back. Retreat and live, my friend.
The battle you enter will be bloody. I advise caution, my Ally. Even retreat.
Be careful, the enemy seems an ant, but I see him an elephant.
Rethink your fight, my friend, we can discuss plans over cups of frothing ayran.
When enemies gather like bees to honey victory will be sweet.
They are afraid of us, see how they rally together.
I prefer a nice warm bath after winning such an easy battle.
One does not burn a blanket to get rid of a flea like our enemy.
We will drink thick boza to toast my victory. You do like chickpeas, yes?
Another victory for the armies of the Ottoman Empire.
If a man is judged by his work, I will be a hero when I return home.
A hard won victory for our noble Alliance!
My armies will be wolves among sheep.
Perhaps after this battle you would join me for a meal.
This battle will be good practice for my men.
I will leave this battle to one of my Viziers.
Our enemy is a green twig, easily bent ... and broken.
A heavy stone is not easily moved. Thank you for your aid.
Reinforcements have turned the tide just as drop by drop, water will make a pond.
Our enemies gather like buzzing flies!
Another army joins the battle! They multiply like rabbits!
I agree. The candle does not give light to itself.
I am Ottoman. Artillery is my specialty.
More cannon! More cannon for my good friend!
Artillery you say? It will be my pleasure!
I will train cannon and guard them with Hussars.
I will send janissaries and cannon.
You will hear the charge of a thousand horses.
I agree with that assessment. We will train cavalry to use against the enemy.
Ottomans have strong hussars. We will be glad to bring them to battle.
I will train hussars and support them with cannon.
I will train a mixed army -- some horse and some foot.
We will sharpen our scimitars and polish our muskets and prepare a glorious army of infantry.
My janissaries will enjoy marching into battle.
Janissaries and artillery. The perfect Ottoman army!
We will train janissaries and support them with cavalry units.
All that I have would be yours, my friend, if indeed I had anything.
Although I must suffer in great agony for denying such a noble request I still must do so.
I am not worthy to be your ally, for I cannot afford your request. I hope someday your children's children can forgive me.
That would be possible, yet I seem to have spent what little I had.
You can ask a thousand times, and the answer will still be no.
Although you deserve much more, such a thing is not to be.
I would grant you the keys to the gates of paradise if I could, but for now, I can do nothing.
I know it is your expectation the Ottoman army to be mighty and endless, but sometimes our reputation precedes us and we have not the troops just yet.
I could send you our finest cooks, tailors and animal handlers, but as for soldiers, we have none.
We are a long way from the Ottoman Empire, my friend, and I have not the troops to spare.
If such a thing were possible, but it is not.
A force greater than both of us prevents that.
It has been decreed that such a thing is not to be.
We are but a poor colony with few soldiers.
I have a janissary or two, but not enough to be of assistance.
My troops are dining at the moment. I cannot spare them.
We were so close to victory, my friend. Perhaps we should try again.
They destroyed one of our trading posts and stole our well-deserved victory away.
The French will surrender. They often do.
I have fought Germans many times, so I know they will soon resign.
There is only room for one Ottoman colony. And it will be mine.
We will drive them back to Portugal!
These Russians will not be a threat much longer.
Remember back when the Spanish were actually dangerous?
The British army is quite strong.
I do not know how they do it, but the Dutch are a big threat.
France often has a huge army and I fear this time is no exception.
I have fought Germans many times. They can be quite dangerous.
It appears I have a rival for control of the Ottoman Empire.
Keep your eye on the Portuguese. They are our biggest threat.
Russians like to attack early. Be prepared.
These Spanish often have strong infantry and cavalry.
You advance quickly. That is good, but do not over extend yourself.
I have seen birds that do not fly as fast as you. I hope you did not advance too early.
You must have resources coming in quickly to be able to go up before me. Let us use that to our advantage.
Our enemy is forging alliances with the local people.
Did you see that? Our enemy has allied with another native American.
Our enemy appears to be going for a native American strategy.
Let our enemy forge alliances. It will come to naught in the end.
You need to advance in Age if you are to have a military.
Is this some secret strategy, my friend, or have hard times fallen upon you?
Staying in an early Age for so long can be dangerous ...
Are you behind, my friend? How can I help?
Have faith, my ally. Though you are behind, it is not too late to advance to the next Age.
He who asks advice passes the mountain; he who does not loses his way on the level plain. Do you need aid?
We are allies, it is no shame to ask for help.
Do you need coin or food to advance in Age? I will share if I can.
You have beaten our enemy to the second Age!
If skills could be learned by watching, every dog would be a butcher and we would all advance in Age with you.
One day share with me the secret of your speed.
Our enemies will eat the dust kicked up by your progress.
With patience mulberry leaves become satin. I am sure you are weaving very fine cloth.
A horse ridden slowly reaches its destination, my friend.
The enemy rushes forward blindly in haste. You are patient and wise.
We harvest what we sow. You have sown patience, we will harvest victory.
My explorer is rescued. You have the gratitude of the Ottoman Empire.
My explorer is on his feet. I will send word of your deeds to his family.
You have rescued my explorer and saved me coin! I am truly grateful.
My explorer, you saved him. I hope that he may be of service to you soon.
The family of my explorer sends their gratitude for his rescue.
My faithful explorer is rescued. Hopefully he will be more cautious in the future.
I have saved us from the lion's jaws!
I have stopped the timer! We must take advantage of this opportunity.
Our enemies will barter with these natives no more.
These natives may wish to barter with us now.
Our enemy's alliance with these natives is broken.
These natives may wish to ally with the Ottomans now.
Again, I have conquered our enemy.
I have brought falling embers to our enemy's colony.
Our enemy's colony sheds embers into the darkening sky.
The cries and smoke are thick in our enemy's colony.
White clothes become dirty. Our enemy's colony is no more.
Our enemy will not grow fat from this trading post.
The enemy controls this trading post no longer.
This trading post is dead to me.
I have destroyed an enemy trading post.
Our enemy's trading post is burnt to the ground.
The enemy's alliance with this tribe is sound, I will have to try again.
Our enemy's alliance with this tribe is as thick as marble.
I did not expect their buildings to be so well constructed ...
The enemy colony still stands ... for now.
I underestimated their preparedness. It will not happen again, my Ally.
My most sincere apologies, ally. I did not destroy the trading post.
You must excuse me, my ally, my explorer has fallen and I must prepare his family for the news.
This New World is full of evil beasts with sharp teeth, some of which have claimed my explorer.
There is little to gain from further conflict.
I am fighting our enemy here - rally your soldiers to the banner of Suleiman the Magnificent!
The enemy swarms my colony like fleas on a camel!
I am besieged! At meal time! Our enemy is less than a dog.
I am Suleiman the Magnificent. Perhaps you have heard of me?
I am Suleiman the Magnificent. I toast the beginning of our alliance with warm boza!
I am Suleiman the Magnificent. I AM the Ottoman Empire.
Our engagements grow more and more challenging. I trust you are ready.
You are wise to choose your battles carefully. A stair is climbed step by step.
He who was once my enemy is now my friend.
Greetings again. Perhaps this time I will keep up with you.
So I defeated you before, and now you come to me as an ally? So be it. I shall not turn you away.
I hope that you learned from me during our last encounter.
Be strong this time. One crow does not make winter.
You like to fight on this map, yes?
This time we shall win. Patience is the key to paradise.
So, shall we drive them before us once more?
Once a friend, always a friend. We will be victorious again.
My explorer is restored to me, his family has sent ransom in cattle and silks.
Good. My explorer can now resume humble service to Suleiman the Magnificent.
Our mutual enemy's town appears defenseless.
It seems our enemy's colony is undefended.
Our enemy appears to have no infantry. Perhaps we should strike.
I have seen the enemy town and did not see a barracks. We should not expect an army of infantry.
My scouts report that our enemy is not training cavalry.
Ottoman scouts report that there is no stable in our enemy's colony.
Ottomans always have coin to spare.
The generosity of the Ottoman Empire is legendary. Have some coin.
I was going to commission a new saddle for my horse, but perhaps this coin is better spent on you instead.
You can never say that Suleiman never gave you anything.
He who has no bread has no authority.
A person cannot fight on an empty stomach.
Janissaries are famous for their cooking. Perhaps you'd like a taste?
Olives from the Mediterranean. Dates from Mesopotamia. All for you to sample.
Janissaries never march to war without their soup pots. Perhaps you'd like to share?
This lumber came all the way from Asia.
Wood. Wood for buildings, for ships, and for artillery.
Here, my friend. Use this wood for the glory of both our nations.
To celebrate our alliance, I have sent you a gift of fine lumber.
I was going to cast this away, seeing how flush with resources my colonies are, but perhaps you can make use of this wood.
Prepare to witness my magnificent attack upon our unsuspecting enemy.
Like a wind across the desert, my forces ride towards the enemy colony.
We will fall upon the enemy colony like lions at the feast.
Study this colony well. In a moment there will be nothing left.
Now you will see the full might of the Ottoman Empire as we raze this town.
Now you will watch as the little people flee before me!
If you see smoke on the horizon, it is my army in our enemy's town.
My soldiers rally under the crescent banner. We march!
Our enemy has forged an alliance with the natives here. It will not last.
He who has no bread has no authority. I go to take the bread from our enemy.
My soldiers march to join yours, my ally.
Guests bring good luck - I will join you in your attack.
A wise man remembers his friends at all times. I am sending soldiers with you.
I am building a new camp to train soldiers.
The Ottomans claim this territory for our next colony.
Soon this land too will experience the bounty of the Ottoman Empire.
Suleiman the Magnificent claims this land for a new colony.
I am going to convince these native Americans to form an alliance.
A thousand friends are too few. I will try to ally with the native Americans here.
We need more trade. I will start with this site.
Coffee and silk will bring great wealth in these lands. I will build a trading post.
I will not let this building fall while my soldiers have breath.
I will make my stand here.
I will hold this ground until star and moon fall.
I will defend our alliance with the native Americans.
I am sending soldiers to protect our alliance with the native Americans.
My soldiers will defend this town through a thousand winters.
This town will not fall to our enemy.
I will defend the Trade Route. One who handles honey licks his fingers.
Gold does not rust on the ground, but this trading post will not defend itself.
I will share the wealth of my empire by sending you coin.
When my coffers overflow, I will send extra coin to you.
My silos are full. I can send you Food.
A red apple invites stones, but I will continue to share my Food with you.
If you can still use wood, I will continue to send it.
Our buildings are of stone and plaster, I will send you wood that we do not use.
I am on my way. Hold as long as you can!
My soldiers rally to your flag!
The armies of Suleiman the Magnificent will arrive soon.
My people say if you have never been sun burned, you will never know a shadow's value.
My people say listen a hundred times; ponder a thousand times; speak once.
My people say two watermelons cannot be held under one arm.
My people say coffee should be strong as death, sweet as love, and black as hell.
My people say the plumber's house always leaks.
My people say you will reach for a snake if you fall into the sea.
My people say do not search for a calf under the ox.
A wise man remembers his friends at all times; a fool, only when he has need of them.
Patience is bitter, but it bears sweet fruit.
My people say no one gives alms to a closed palm. Do you need anything?
If you trust me as an ally, you will send me coin.
Can you spare coin? It will be a good investment.
Do you have Food you can spare?
An open mouth remains not hungry. I need Food, my ally.
My colony grows. Can you spare some wood?
The sight of your army makes me smile, friend.
I shall treat your army to a feast when we are done!
Your soldiers are a welcome sight!
I can use that coin. My thanks.
We shall put this Food to good use.
My thanks for your assistance. It takes two hands to make a sound.
I, Suleiman the Magnificent, thank you.
I will spend any resources you can send to me.
The British are cunning and their armies are well-equipped. It does not look good for us.
The Dutch know more of warfare than I expected. The outlook is grim.
The French are as dangerous as I feared. We fight a losing fight.
The Germans are a relentless enemy. We are losing ground.
It is not surprising that one of my countrymen is a match for both of us.
The Portuguese are endlessly resourceful. This is a dark day.
Is there nothing we can do to turn the Russian tide?
The Spanish stand poised to crush us. We only have to wait.
My children's grandchildren will be shamed by losing to the British.
Despite their inferior troops, the Dutch continue to defeat us.
It is humiliating that we are losing to the French.
If we lose to the Germans, I will never be considered fit to lead in battle again.
I cannot stand to lose to this traitorous Ottoman commander.
I cannot believe you allowed the Portuguese to beat us.
The Russians swarm like ants ... and we let them.
I do not know how I allowed the Spanish to beat us.
We sprinkle blood on a dying tree. Blood I can spare no longer.
My armies have fought like lions to protect our colonies, but it is not enough.
A white day sheds light, a black day sheds darkness. This is a white day.
You do well, my ally. A lion sleeps in the heart of every brave man.
Though I am the stronger, I know you will still contribute to this alliance.
We fought valiantly, but the time has come to resign.
A white day sheds light, a black day sheds darkness. This is a black day.
Every sheep is hung by his own leg, I fear we head toward slaughter.
We cannot win this. Empty words will not fill an empty stomach.
Even the highest tree has an axe waiting at its foot. We are finished.
Either drive this camel to pasture or leave the country - we are done here!
It is easier to teach a camel to jump than to convince you to resign!
We should have known they would try to win this way.
Our enemy has established an alliance with some of the native Americans here. We should pursue our own alliances.
Our enemy is swift or we are slow. We should build our own trading posts. Or destroy his.
The native Americans have found a strong ally in you.
And in another thing you are the first.
